translated: A doubtful document should be established by the letters, marks made by them, leaves, and reasons created by them, which resemble those reasons.

original: yatraṛṇī dhaniko vāpi sākṣī vā lekhako 'pi vā / mriyate tatra tallekhyaṃ tatsvahastaiḥ prasādhayet //
analyzed: yatra ṛṇī dhanikaḥ vā api sākṣī vā vā mriyate tatra tat lekhyam tad sva hastaiḥ prasādhayet
translated: Where the debtor, the creditor, the witness, or even the scribe dies, that document should be established by their own handwriting.

analyzed: atha a sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: Now, about witnesses.

analyzed: na rāja śrotriya pravrajita kitava taskara para adhīna strī bāla sāhasika ati vṛddha matta unmata abhiśasta patita kṣudh tṛṣṇā ārta vyasani rāga andhāḥ
translated: A king, a learned Brahmin, a renunciant, a gambler, a thief, a woman under the control of others, a child, a rash person, one who is extremely old, intoxicated, insane, accused of a crime, fallen, afflicted by hunger or thirst, addicted, blind, or deaf should not be a witness.

analyzed: ripu mitra artha saṃbandhi vikarma dṛṣṭa doṣa sahāyāḥ ca
translated: Nor should one who is related to an enemy or a friend, one who has a conflict of interest, one who has been seen to have faults, or one who is an accomplice.

original: anirdiṣṭas tu sākṣitve yaś copetya brūyāt //
analyzed: a nirdiṣṭaḥ tu sākṣi tve yaḥ ca upetya brūyāt
translated: But one who is not appointed as a witness, and who speaks after being approached,

analyzed: ekaḥ ca a sākṣī
translated: And one who is alone, should not be a witness.

analyzed: steya sāhasa vāgdaṇḍa pāruṣya saṃgrahaṇeṣu sākṣiṇaḥ na parīkṣyāḥ
translated: In cases of theft, violence, defamation, and assault, the witnesses need not be examined.

analyzed: atha sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: Now, about the witnesses.

original: kulajā vṛttavittasaṃpannā yajvānas tapasvinaḥ putriṇo dharmajñā adhīyānāḥ satyavantas traividyavṛddhāś ca //
analyzed: kula jāḥ vṛtta vitta saṃpannāḥ yajvānaḥ tapasvinaḥ putriṇaḥ dharma jñāḥ adhīyānāḥ satyavantaḥ traividya vṛddhāḥ ca
translated: Those born in noble families, possessing good conduct and wealth, performing sacrifices, ascetics, having sons, knowing dharma, studying, truthful, and elderly scholars of the three Vedas.

analyzed: abhihita guṇa saṃpannaḥ ubhaya anumataḥ ekaḥ pi
translated: Even a single person possessing the mentioned qualities and approved by both parties.

original: dvayor vivadamānayor yasya pūrvavādas tasya sākṣiṇaḥ praṣṭavyāḥ //
analyzed: dvayoḥ vivadamānayoḥ yasya pūrva vādaḥ tasya sākṣiṇaḥ praṣṭavyāḥ
translated: In a dispute between two parties, the witnesses of the party stating the case first should be questioned.

original: ādharyaṃ kāryavaśād yatra pūrvapakṣasya bhavet tatra prativādino 'pi //
analyzed: ādharyam kārya vaśāt yatra pūrvapakṣasya bhavet tatra
translated: Where the party stating the case first has a subordinate position due to the nature of the matter, the witnesses of the opposing party should also be questioned.

original: uddiṣṭasākṣiṇi mṛte deśāntaragate ca tadabhihitaśrotāraḥ pramāṇam //
analyzed: uddiṣṭa sākṣiṇi mṛte deśa antara gate ca tad abhihita śrotāraḥ pramāṇam
translated: If a witness named is dead or has gone to a foreign country, those who have heard his statement are the authority.

analyzed: samakṣa darśanāt sākṣī śravaṇāt vā
translated: A witness is so called because he has seen or heard the matter in question.

analyzed: sākṣiṇaḥ ca satyena pūyante
translated: Witnesses are purified by the truth.

analyzed: varṇinām yatra vadhaḥ tatra anṛtena
translated: In cases where Brahmins are killed, they are purified by untruth.

analyzed: tad pāvanāya kūśmāṇḍībhiḥ dvijaḥ gnim ghṛtena juhuyāt
translated: For their purification, a Brahmin should offer Kusha-grass and ghee into the fire.

original: śūdra ekāhikam godaśakasya grāsaṃ dadyāt // svabhāvavikṛtau mukhavarṇavināśe 'saṃbaddhapralāpe ca kūṭasākṣiṇaṃ vidyāt //
analyzed: śūdraḥ ekāhikam godaśakasya grāsam dadyāt svabhāva vikṛtau mukha varṇa vināśe saṃbaddha pralāpe ca kūṭa sākṣiṇam vidyāt
translated: One should know a perjured witness as one whose natural complexion is altered, whose face is disfigured, and who utters incoherent prattle.

analyzed: sākṣiṇaḥ ca āhūya āditya udaye kṛta śapathān pṛcchet
translated: Having summoned the witnesses, he should question them at sunrise, after they have taken an oath.

analyzed: brūhi iti brāhmaṇam pṛcchet
translated: He should ask a Brāhmaṇa, saying, Speak!

analyzed: satyam brūhi iti rājanyam
translated: He should ask a Kṣatriya, saying, Speak the truth!

analyzed: go bīja kāñcanaiḥ vaiśyam
translated: He should ask a Vaiśya, By cows, seeds, and gold!

analyzed: sarva mahāpātakaiḥ tu śūdram
translated: He should ask a Śūdra, By all the mortal sins!

analyzed: sākṣiṇaḥ ca śrāvayet
translated: And he should make the witnesses hear:

original: ye mahāpātakināṃ lokā ye copapātakināṃ te kūṭasākṣiṇām api //🔽satyenādityas tapati //
analyzed: ye mahāpātakinām lokāḥ ye ca upapātakinām te kūṭa sākṣiṇām api  satyena ādityaḥ tapati
translated: The worlds of those who commit perjury are the same as those of the mortal sinners and the minor sinners.🔽The sun shines by truth.

analyzed: satyena bhāti candramāḥ  satyena vāti pavanaḥ
translated: The moon shines by truth.🔽The wind blows by truth.

analyzed: satyena bhūḥ dhārayati
translated: The earth supports by truth.

analyzed: satyena āpaḥ tiṣṭhanti  satyena agniḥ
translated: The waters stand by truth.🔽The fire burns by truth.

analyzed: kham ca satyena
translated: And the sky by truth.

analyzed: satyena devāḥ
translated: The gods by truth.

analyzed: satyena yajñāḥ
translated: The sacrifices by truth.

original: aśvamedhasahasraṃ ca satyaṃ ca tulayā dhṛtam / aśvamedhasahasrād dhi satyam eva viśiṣyate //
analyzed: aśvamedha sahasram ca satyam ca tulayā dhṛtam aśvamedha sahasrāt hi satyam eva viśiṣyate
translated: A thousand horse sacrifices and truth weighed in a balance, when a thousand horse sacrifices and truth are weighed, truth alone excels a thousand horse sacrifices.

original: jānanto 'pi hi ye sākṣye tūṣṇīṃbhūtā udāsate / te kūṭasākṣiṇāṃ pāpais tulyā daṇḍena cāpy atha // evaṃ hi sākṣiṇaḥ pṛcched varṇānukramato nṛpaḥ //
analyzed: jānantaḥ pi hi ye sākṣye tūṣṇīṃbhūtāḥ udāsate te kūṭa sākṣiṇām pāpaiḥ tulyāḥ daṇḍena ca api atha  evam hi sākṣiṇaḥ pṛcchet varṇa anukramataḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Thus the king should question the witnesses in the order of their castes.

original: yasyocuḥ sākṣiṇaḥ satyāṃ pratijñāṃ sa jayī bhavet /
analyzed: yasya ūcuḥ sākṣiṇaḥ satyām pratijñām sa jayī bhavet
translated: He whose witnesses speak the truth, he shall be declared the winner.

original: anyathā vādino yasya dhruvas tasya parājayaḥ //
analyzed: anyathā vādinaḥ yasya dhruvaḥ tasya parājayaḥ
translated: He whose witnesses speak otherwise, his defeat is certain.

analyzed: bahu tvam pratigṛhṇīyāt sākṣi dvaidhe narādhipaḥ
translated: In case of a conflict of witnesses, the king should accept the majority.

analyzed: sameṣu ca guṇa utkṛṣṭān guṇi dvaidhe dvijottamān
translated: And in case of equality, the best among the virtuous, the best of the twice-born, in case of a conflict of the virtuous.

original: yasmin yasmin vivāde tu kūṭasākṣy anṛtaṃ vadet /
analyzed: yasmin yasmin vivāde tu kūṭa sākṣī anṛtam vadet
translated: In whatever dispute a false witness speaks falsely,

original: tattatkāryaṃ nivarteta kṛtaṃ cāpy akṛtaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: tat tat kāryam nivarteta kṛtam ca api akṛtam bhavet
translated: that matter shall be reversed, and what is done shall be as if not done.

analyzed: atha samaya kriyā
translated: Now, the rules of settlement:

analyzed: rāja droha sāhaseṣu yathākāmam
translated: In cases of treason and violence, as one pleases.

analyzed: nikṣepa steyeṣu artha pramāṇam
translated: In cases of deposit and theft, the value of the object.

analyzed: sarveṣu eva artha jāteṣu mūlyam kanakam kalpayet
translated: In all matters of wealth, one should consider gold as the standard.

original: tatra kṛṣṇalone śūdraṃ dūrvākaraṃ śāpayet //🔽dvikṛṣṇalone tilakaram //
analyzed: tatra kṛṣṇala ūne śūdram dūrvā karam śāpayet  dvi kṛṣṇala ūne tila karam
translated: In a debt of one kṛṣṇala, one should make the Śūdra take an oath with a handful of durvā grass.🔽In a debt of two kṛṣṇalas, with a handful of sesamum seeds.

analyzed: tri kṛṣṇala ūne rajata karam
translated: In a debt of three kṛṣṇalas, with a handful of silver.

analyzed: catur kṛṣṇala ūne suvarṇakaram
translated: In a debt of four kṛṣṇalas, with a handful of gold.
If the amount is less than five kṛṣṇalas, the fine is the value of the land recovered by the plough.

original: suvarṇārdhone kośo deyaḥ śūdrasya // tataḥ paraṃ yathārhaṃ dhaṭāgnyudakaviṣāṇām anyatamam //
analyzed: suvarṇa ardha ūne kośaḥ deyaḥ śūdrasya tatas param yathārham dhaṭa agni udaka viṣāṇām anyatamam
translated: If the amount is less than half a suvarṇa, the fine is a kosha.

analyzed: dviguṇe rthe yathā abhihitāḥ samaya kriyāḥ vaiśyasya
translated: If the amount is double, the same settlement is made as in the case of a vaiśya.

analyzed: triguṇe rājanyasya
translated: If it is treble, as in the case of a kṣatriya.

analyzed: kośa varjam caturguṇe brāhmaṇasya
translated: If it is four times, as in the case of a brahmin, except the kosha.

analyzed: na brāhmaṇasya kośam dadyāt
translated: One should not give the kosha to a brahmin.

analyzed: anyatra āgāmi kāla samaya nibandhana kriyātaḥ
translated: Except in the case of a settlement for future time.

analyzed: kośa sthāne brāhmaṇam sītā uddhṛta mahī karam eva śāpayet
translated: In place of the kosha, one should make the brahmin plough the land with a plough drawn by a bull.

original: prāgdṛṣṭadoṣe svalpe 'py arthe divyānām anyatamam eva kārayet //
analyzed: prāk dṛṣṭa doṣe su alpe pi arthe divyānām anyatamam eva kārayet
translated: Even in a small matter, if the fault is already known, one should make him undergo one of the ordeals.

original: satsu viditaṃ sac caritaṃ na mahaty arthe 'pi //
analyzed: satsu viditam sat caritam na mahati arthe
translated: Even in a great matter, the truth is known when it is well-known.

analyzed: abhiyoktā vartayet śīrṣam
translated: The complainant should put his head on the balance.

analyzed: abhiyuktaḥ ca divyam kuryāt
translated: And the accused should undergo the ordeal.

analyzed: rāja droha sāhaseṣu vinā api śīrṣa vartanāt
translated: Even without putting the head on the balance, in the case of treason and violence.

analyzed: strī brāhmaṇa vikala asamartha rogiṇām tulā deyā
translated: But for women, brahmins, the disabled, the incapable, and the sick, the balance should be given.

analyzed: sā ca na vāti vāyau
translated: And that does not blow in the wind.

analyzed: na kuṣṭhi asamartha lohakārāṇām agniḥ deyaḥ
translated: Fire should not be given to lepers, the incapable, and blacksmiths.

analyzed: śarad grīṣmayoḥ ca
translated: And in autumn and summer.

analyzed: na kuṣṭhi paittika brāhmaṇānām viṣam deyam
translated: And poison should not be given to lepers, those with bile diseases, and Brahmins.

analyzed: prāvṛṣi ca
translated: And in the rainy season.

original: na śleṣmavyādhyarditānāṃ bhīrūṇāṃ śvāsakāsinām ambujīvināṃ codakam //
analyzed: na śleṣma vyādhi arditānām bhīrūṇām śvāsa kāsinām ambu jīvinām ca udakam
translated: And water should not be given to those afflicted with phlegm diseases, the timid, those with asthma and cough, and those who live in water.

analyzed: hemanta śiśirayoḥ ca
translated: And in winter and early summer.

analyzed: na nāstikebhyaḥ kośaḥ deyaḥ
translated: A treasury should not be given to atheists.

analyzed: na deśe vyādhi maraka upasṛṣṭe ce
translated: And not in a country afflicted by disease and death.

original: sacailasnātam āhūya sūryodaya upoṣitam / kārayet sarvadivyāni devabrāhmaṇasaṃnidhau //
analyzed: sa caila snātam āhūya sūrya udaye upoṣitam kārayet sarva divyāni deva brāhmaṇa saṃnidhau
translated: Having called the person who has bathed with his clothes, fasted at sunrise, all the ordeals should be performed in the presence of gods and Brahmins.

analyzed: atha dhaṭaḥ
translated: Now, the ordeal by balance.

analyzed: catur hasta ucchritaḥ dvi hasta āyataḥ
translated: It is four cubits high and two cubits wide.

analyzed: tatra sāra vṛkṣa udbhavā pañca hasta āyata ubhayatas śikyā tulā
translated: There, the balance beam should be made of a strong tree, five cubits long, with two ropes on each side.

analyzed: tām ca suvarṇakāra kāṃsyakārāṇām anyatamaḥ bibhṛyāt
translated: And that should be held by a goldsmith or a brass worker.

original: pratimānapuruṣau samadhṛtau sucihnitau kṛtvā puruṣam avatārayet //
analyzed: pratimāna puruṣau sama dhṛtau su cihnitau kṛtvā puruṣam avatārayet
translated: Having made two standard men well-balanced and well-marked, one should weigh the man.

analyzed: dhaṭam ca samayena gṛhṇīyāt
translated: And one should take the balance beam on a pledge.

analyzed: tulādhāram ca
translated: And the holder of the balance.

original: brahmaghnāṃ ye smṛtā lokā ye lokāḥ kūṭasākṣiṇām /
analyzed: brahma ghnām ye smṛtāḥ lokāḥ ye lokāḥ kūṭa sākṣiṇām
translated: Those worlds that are known as the killers of Brahmins, and those worlds of perjurers,

analyzed: dharma paryāya vacanaiḥ dhaṭaḥ iti abhidhīyase
translated: You are called the balance by the words of the Dharma discourse.

original: tvam eva dhaṭa jānīṣe na vidur yāni mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: tvam eva dhaṭa jānīṣe na viduḥ yāni mānuṣāḥ
translated: You alone know what humans do not know.

original: vyavahārābhiśasto 'yaṃ mānuṣas tolyate tvayi / tad enaṃ saṃśayād asmād dharmatas trātum arhasi //
analyzed: vyavahāra abhiśastaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ tolyate tvayi  tat enam saṃśayāt asmāt dharmataḥ trātum arhasi
translated: This human, accused in a legal dispute, is being weighed by you. Therefore, it is proper for you to save him from this doubt according to the law.

original: tatas tv āropayec chikye bhūya evātha taṃ naram / tulito yadi vardheta tataḥ śuddhaḥ sa dharmataḥ //
analyzed: tatas tu āropayet śikye bhūyas eva atha tam naram tulitaḥ yadi vardheta tatas śuddhaḥ sa dharmataḥ
translated: Then he should again make the man stand on the scales. If he gains weight, then he is pure according to the law.

analyzed: śikya cheda akṣa bhaṅgeṣu bhūyas tu āropayet naram
translated: In case of the breaking of the scales or the breaking of the balance, the man should be made to stand on the scales again.

analyzed: atha agniḥ
translated: Now, about fire.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa aṅgulam tāvat antaram maṇḍala saptakam kuryāt
translated: He should make a set of seven circles with an interval of sixteen finger-breadths.

original: tataḥ prāṅmukhasya prasāritabhujadvayasya saptāśvatthapatrāṇi karayor dadyāt //
analyzed: tatas prāc mukhasya prasārita bhuja dvayasya sapta aśvattha patrāṇi karayoḥ dadyāt
translated: Then, for one facing east with both arms outstretched, he should place seven leaves of the holy fig tree on the hands.

analyzed: tāni ca kara dvaya sahitāni sūtreṇa veṣṭayet
translated: And those, together with the two hands, should be wrapped with a thread.

original: tatas tatrāgnivarṇaṃ lohapiṇḍaṃ pañcāśatpalikaṃ samaṃ nyaset //
analyzed: tatas tatra agnivarṇam loha piṇḍam pañcāśat palikam samam nyaset
translated: Then, he should place there an iron ball of the color of fire, weighing fifty palas, evenly.

original: tam ādāya nātidrutaṃ nātivilambitaṃ maṇḍaleṣu pādanyāsaṃ kurvan vrajet //
analyzed: tam ādāya na atidrutam na ati vilambitam maṇḍaleṣu pāda nyāsam kurvan vrajet
translated: Taking that, he should walk in the circles, placing his feet not too quickly and not too slowly.

original: tataḥ saptamaṃ maṇḍalam atītya bhūmau lohapiṇḍaṃ jahyāt //
analyzed: tatas saptamam maṇḍalam atītya bhūmau loha piṇḍam jahyāt
translated: Then, having passed the seventh circle, he should leave the iron ball on the ground.

original: yo hastayoḥ kvacid dagdhas tam aśuddhaṃ vinirdiṣet /
analyzed: yaḥ hastayoḥ kvacid dagdhaḥ tam aśuddham vinirdiṣet
translated: One who is burnt anywhere on the hands should be declared impure.

original: na dagdhaḥ sarvathā yas tu sa viśuddho bhaven naraḥ //
analyzed: na dagdhaḥ sarvathā yaḥ tu sa viśuddhaḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: But a man who is not burnt at all should be considered pure.

original: bhayād vā pātayed yas tu dagdho vā na vibhāvyate / punas taṃ hārayel lohaṃ samayasyāviśodhanāt //
analyzed: bhayāt vā pātayet yaḥ tu dagdhaḥ vā na vibhāvyate punar tam hārayet loham samayasya aviśodhanāt
translated: But if one throws down the iron ball out of fear, or if it is not clearly burnt, then the iron ball should be thrown again, because the test has not been completed.

original: abhimantryāsya karayor lohapiṇḍaṃ tato nyaset // tvam agne sarvabhūtānām antaś carasi sākṣivat / tvam evāgne vijānīṣe na vidur yāni mānavāḥ //
analyzed: abhimantrya asya karayoḥ loha piṇḍam tatas nyaset  tvam agne sarva bhūtānām antar carasi sākṣi vat  tvam eva agne vijānīṣe na viduḥ yāni mānavāḥ
translated: Having enchanted it, he should then place the iron ball in his hands, saying: You, O Agni, move within all beings as a witness. You alone, O Agni, know what men do not know.

original: vyavahārābhiśasto 'yaṃ mānuṣaḥ śuddhim icchati / tad enaṃ saṃśayād asmād dharmatas trātum arhasi //
analyzed: vyavahāra abhiśastaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ śuddhim icchati tat enam saṃśayāt asmāt dharmataḥ trātum arhasi
translated: This human being, accused in a legal dispute, desires purification. You should therefore deliver him from this doubt according to the law.

analyzed: atha udakam
translated: Now, the water test.

analyzed: paṅka śaivāla duṣṭa grāha matsya jalaukā ādi varjite mbhasi
translated: In water free from mud, moss, harmful crocodiles, fish, leeches, etc.🔽There,

original: tatra / / /nābhimagnasyārogadveṣiṇaḥ puruṣasyānyasya jānunī gṛhītvābhimantritam ambhaḥ praviśet //
analyzed: tatra nābhi magnasya aroga dveṣiṇaḥ puruṣasya anyasya jānunī gṛhītvā abhimantritam ambhaḥ praviśet
translated: having grasped the knees of another person who is free from disease and hatred, he should enter the water while reciting the mantra.

original: tatsamakālaṃ ca nātikrūramṛdunā dhanuṣā puruṣo 'paraḥ śarakṣepaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: tad sama kālam ca na ati krūra mṛdunā dhanuṣā puruṣaḥ paras śara kṣepam kuryāt
translated: At the same time, another person should shoot an arrow with a bow that is neither too strong nor too weak.

original: taṃ cāparaḥ puruṣo javena śaram ānayet //
analyzed: tam ca aparaḥ puruṣaḥ javena śaram ānayet
translated: And another person would quickly bring a second arrow.

original: anyathā hy aviśuddhaḥ syād ekāṅgasyāpi darśane //
analyzed: anyathā hi aviśuddhaḥ syāt eka aṅgasya api darśane
translated: Otherwise, he would be impure, even if only one limb is seen.

original: tvam ambhaḥ sarvabhūtānām antaś carasi sākṣivat / tvam evāmbho vijānīṣe na vidur yāni mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: tvam ambhaḥ sarva bhūtānām antar carasi sākṣi vat  tvam eva ambhaḥ vijānīṣe na viduḥ yāni mānuṣāḥ
translated: You, water, move within all beings like a witness. You alone, water, know what humans do not know.

original: vyavahārābhiśato 'yaṃ mānuṣas tvayi majjati / tad enaṃ saṃśayād asmād dharmatas trātum arhasi //
analyzed: vyavahāra abhiśataḥ yam mānuṣaḥ tvayi majjati tat enam saṃśayāt asmāt dharmataḥ trātum arhasi
translated: This human, accused in legal matters, sinks in you. You should save him from this doubt according to the law.

analyzed: atha viṣam
translated: Now, about poison.

analyzed: viṣāni adeyāni sārvāṇi
translated: All poisons should not be given,

analyzed: ṛte himācala udbhavāt śārṅgāt
translated: except for the poison of the Sharnga deer born in the Himalayas.

original: tasya ca yavasaptakaṃ ghṛtaplutam abhiśastāya dadyāt //
analyzed: tasya ca yava saptakam ghṛta plutam abhiśastāya dadyāt
translated: And he should give seven barley grains soaked in ghee to the accused.🔽If the poison is digested easily without any discomfort,

original: viṣaṃ vegaklamāpetaṃ sukhena yadi jīryate / viśuddhaṃ tam iti jñātvā divasānte visarjayet //
analyzed: viṣam vega klama apetam sukhena yadi jīryate viśuddham tam iti jñātvā divasa ante visarjayet
translated: knowing that he is pure, he should be discharged at the end of the day.

original: viṣatvād viṣamatvāc ca krūraṃ tvaṃ sarvadehinām /
analyzed: viṣa tvāt viṣama tvāt ca krūram tvam sarva dehinām
translated: O poison, you are cruel to all embodied beings because of your poisonous nature.

original: tvam eva viṣa jānīṣe na vidur yāni mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: tvam eva viṣa jānīṣe na viduḥ yāni mānuṣāḥ
translated: You alone, poison, know what humans do not know.

original: vyavahārābhiśasto 'yaṃ mānuṣaḥ śuddhim icchati / tad enaṃ saṃśayād asmād dharmatas trātum arhasi //
analyzed: vyavahāra abhiśastaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ śuddhim icchati tat enam saṃśayāt asmāt dharmataḥ trātum arhasi
translated: This human, accused in legal matters, desires purity. You should save him from this doubt according to the law.

analyzed: atha kośaḥ
translated: Now, the code of conduct.

original: ugrān devān samabhyarcya tatsnānodakāt prasṛtitrayaṃ pibet //
analyzed: ugrān devān samabhyarcya tad snāna udakāt prasṛti trayam pibet
translated: Having worshipped the fierce gods, one should drink three handfuls of water from their bathing water.

original: idaṃ mayā na kṛtam iti vadan sthāpitadevatābhimukhaḥ //
analyzed: idam mayā na kṛtam iti vadan sthāpita devatā abhimukhaḥ
translated: Saying This was not done by me, facing the installed deity.

original: yasya paśyed dvisaptāhāt trisaptāhād athāpi vā /
analyzed: yasya paśyet dvi sapta ahāt tri sapta ahāt atha api vā
translated: If one sees him within two or three weeks,

original: tam aśuddhaṃ vijānīyāt tathā śuddhaṃ viparyaye /
analyzed: tam aśuddham vijānīyāt tathā śuddham viparyaye
translated: one should know him to be impure, and pure in the opposite case.

original: divye ca śuddhaṃ puruṣaṃ sat kuryād dhārmiko nṛpaḥ //
analyzed: divye ca śuddham puruṣam sat kuryāt dhārmikaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: And the righteous king should treat the pure man as pure in the divine law.

analyzed: atha dvādaśa putrāḥ bhavanti
translated: Now, there are twelve kinds of sons.

original: svakṣetre saṃskṛtāyām utpāditaḥ svayam aurasaḥ prathamaḥ //
analyzed: sva kṣetre saṃskṛtāyām utpāditaḥ svayam aurasaḥ prathamaḥ
translated: The first is the natural son begotten on one's own wife by oneself.

analyzed: niyuktāyām sapiṇḍena uttama varṇena vā utpāditaḥ kṣetrajaḥ dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second is the son of the field begotten on a wife appointed by a Sapinda or a man of the highest caste.

analyzed: putrīkā putraḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: The third is the son of a maiden.

original: yas tv asyāḥ putraḥ sa me putro bhaved iti yā pitrā dattā sā putrikā //
analyzed: yaḥ tu asyāḥ putraḥ sa me putraḥ bhavet iti yā pitrā dattā sā putrikā
translated: She who is given by her father, saying Whatever son she bears will be my son, is a maiden.

analyzed: putrikā vidhim vinā api pratipāditā bhrātṛ vihīnā putrikā eva
translated: Even without the rite of a maiden, she who is given without brothers is a maiden only.

analyzed: paunarbhavaḥ caturthaḥ  akṣatā bhūyas saṃskṛtā punarbhūḥ
translated: The fourth is the son of a remarried woman.🔽A remarried woman is one who has been married again after being unchaste.

analyzed: bhūyas tu a saṃskṛtā api parapūrvā
translated: But one who has not been married again, though unchaste, is a former wife.

analyzed: kānīnaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: The fifth is the son of a kidnapped woman.

analyzed: pitṛ gṛhe a saṃskṛtayā eva utpāditaḥ
translated: One born to an unmarried woman in her father's house.

analyzed: sa ca pāṇigrāhasya
translated: And he belongs to the man who married her.

analyzed: gṛhe ca gūḍha utpannaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: The sixth is the son born secretly in the house.

analyzed: yasya talpajaḥ tasya asau
translated: He belongs to the man in whose house he is born.

original: sahoḍhaḥ saptamaḥ //🔽yā garbhiṇī saṃskriyate tasyāḥ putraḥ //
analyzed: sahoḍhaḥ saptamaḥ  yā garbhiṇī saṃskriyate tasyāḥ putraḥ
translated: The seventh is the son born with the wife.🔽The son of a woman who is married while pregnant.

analyzed: sa ca pāṇigrāhasya
translated: And he belongs to the man who married her.

analyzed: dattakaḥ ca aṣṭamaḥ
translated: The eighth is the adopted son.

analyzed: sa ca mātā pitṛbhyām yasya dattaḥ
translated: And he to whom he is given by his parents.

analyzed: krītaḥ ca navamaḥ
translated: The ninth is the bought son.

analyzed: sa ca yena krītaḥ
translated: And he to whom he is bought.

analyzed: svayam upagataḥ daśamaḥ
translated: The tenth is the son who comes of his own accord.

analyzed: sa ca yasya upagataḥ
translated: And he to whom he comes.

analyzed: apaviddhaḥ tu ekādaśaḥ
translated: The eleventh is the son cast off.

analyzed: pitrā mātrā ca parityaktaḥ
translated: Abandoned by his father and mother.

analyzed: sa ca yena gṛhītaḥ
translated: And he by whom he is taken.

analyzed: yatra kvacana utpāditaḥ ca dvādaśaḥ
translated: The twelfth is the son born anywhere.

analyzed: eteṣām pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ śreyān
translated: Of these, the former is better than the latter.

analyzed: saḥ eva dāyaharaḥ
translated: He alone inherits the estate.

analyzed: sa ca anyān bibhṛyāt
translated: And he should support the others.

analyzed: anūḍhānām sva vitta anurūpeṇa saṃskāram kuryāt
translated: He should perform the sacraments according to his means for his unmarried daughters.

analyzed: patita klība acikitsya roga vikalāḥ tu a bhāga hāriṇaḥ
translated: But those who are outcasts, impotent, incurable, and disabled do not inherit.

analyzed: rikthagrāhibhiḥ te bhartavyāḥ
translated: They should be maintained by those who inherit the estate.

original: teṣāṃ caurasāḥ putrā bhāgahāriṇaḥ // na tu patitasya //
analyzed: teṣām ca aurasāḥ putrāḥ bhāga hāriṇaḥ na tu patitasya
translated: And the sons born of their wives inherit, but not the son of an outcast.

original: patanīye karmaṇi kṛte tv anantarotpannāḥ //🔽pratilomāsu strīṣu cotpannāś cābhāginaḥ //
analyzed: patanīye karmaṇi kṛte tu anantara utpannāḥ  pratilomāsu strīṣu ca utpannāḥ ca abhāginaḥ
translated: But those born after a deed that causes degradation (from caste) are excluded.🔽And those born from women of a lower caste are also excluded.

analyzed: tad putrāḥ paitāmahe pi arthe
translated: The sons of such women are not entitled to the property of their grandfather.

analyzed: aṃśa grāhibhiḥ te bharaṇīyāḥ
translated: They should be maintained by those who take shares in the inheritance.

original: yaś cārthaharaḥ sa piṇḍadāyī //🔽ekoḍhānām apy ekasyāḥ putraḥ sarvāsāṃ putra eva //
analyzed: yaḥ ca artha haraḥ sa piṇḍa dāyī  eka ūḍhānām api ekasyāḥ putraḥ sarvāsām putraḥ eva
translated: And he who takes the property is the one who offers the funeral oblations.🔽Even among those married by the single-thread rite, the son of one wife is the son of all.

analyzed: bhrātṝṇām ekajātānām ca
translated: And among brothers born of the same mother.

analyzed: putraḥ pitṛ vitta alābhe pi piṇḍam dadyāt
translated: The son should offer the funeral oblations even if he does not receive the father's property.🔽Since the son rescues the father from the hell called Put,

original: punnāmno narakād yasmāt pitaraṃ trāyate sutaḥ / tasmāt puttra iti proktaḥ svayam eva svayaṃbhuvā //
analyzed: punnāmnaḥ narakāt yasmāt pitaram trāyate sutaḥ tasmāt puttraḥ iti proktaḥ svayam eva svayaṃbhuvā
translated: the Self-Existent One himself has declared him to be a putra (son).

original: ṛṇam asmin saṃnayaty amṛtatvaṃ ca gacchati / pitā putrasya jātasya paśyec cej jīvato mukham //
analyzed: ṛṇam asmin saṃnayati amṛta tvam ca gacchati pitā putrasya jātasya paśyet ced jīvataḥ mukham
translated: If the father sees the face of his son when he is born, he pays off his debt and attains immortality.

original: putreṇa lokān jayati pautreṇānantyam aśnute / atha putrasya pautreṇa bradhnasyāpnoti viṣṭapam //
analyzed: putreṇa lokān jayati pautreṇa ānantyam aśnute  atha putrasya pautreṇa bradhnasya āpnoti viṣṭapam
translated: By the son one conquers the worlds, by the grandson one attains infinity, and by the son's grandson one attains the highest heaven of Indra.

analyzed: pautra dauhitrayoḥ loke viśeṣaḥ na upapadyate
translated: There is no difference between a grandson and a daughter's son in this world.

original: dauhitro 'pi hy aputraṃ taṃ saṃtārayati pautravat //
analyzed: dauhitraḥ u pi hi aputram tam saṃtārayati pautra vat
translated: For a daughter's son also delivers him who has no son, just like a grandson.

analyzed: samāna varṇāsu putrāḥ savarṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: Sons born of women of the same caste as the father are of the same caste as the father.

analyzed: anulomāsu mātṛ savarṇāḥ
translated: Sons born of women of castes immediately lower than the father's are of the same caste as the mother.

analyzed: tatra vaiśyāputraḥ śūdreṇa āyogavaḥ  pulkasa māgadhau kṣatriyā putrau vaiśya śūdrābhyām
translated: There, the son of a Vaishya woman by a Shudra is an Ayogava.🔽The son of a Kshatriya woman by a Vaishya and a Shudra is a Pulkasa and a Magadha respectively.

analyzed: caṇḍāla vaidehaka sūtāḥ ca brāhmaṇī putrāḥ śūdra viś kṣatriyaiḥ
translated: The sons of a Brahmani woman by a Shudra, a Vaishya, and a Kshatriya are a Chandala, a Vaidehaka, and a Suta respectively.

analyzed: saṃkara saṃkarāḥ ca asaṃkhyeyāḥ
translated: And the offspring of mixed castes are innumerable.

analyzed: raṅgāvataraṇam āyogavānām
translated: Acting in theatres is for Ayogavas.

analyzed: vyādhatā pulkasānām
translated: Hunting is for Pulkasas.

analyzed: stuti kriyā māgadhānām
translated: Praising is for Magadhas.

analyzed: vadhya ghāti tvam caṇḍālānām
translated: Killing criminals is for Chandalas.

analyzed: strī raksā tat jīvanam ca vaidehakānām
translated: Protecting women and living by that is for Vaidehakas.

analyzed: aśva sārathyam sūtānām
translated: Driving horses is for Sutas.

original: caṇḍālānāṃ bahir grāmanivasanaṃ mṛtacailadhāraṇam iti viśeṣaḥ //
analyzed: caṇḍālānām bahis grāma nivasanam mṛta caila dhāraṇam iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: The special duties of Chandalas are living outside the village and wearing the clothes of the dead.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca samāna jātibhiḥ vivāhaḥ
translated: And for all, marriage with those of the same caste.

analyzed: saṃkare jātayaḥ tu etāḥ pitṛ mātṛ pradarśitāḥ
translated: These are the castes born of mixed parentage, indicated by the father and mother,

original: pracchannā vā prakāśā vā veditavyāḥ svakarmabhiḥ //
analyzed: pracchannāḥ vā prakāśāḥ vā veditavyāḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: whether concealed or manifest, to be known by their own occupations.

original: brāhmaṇārthe gavārthe vā dehatyāgo 'nupaskṛtaḥ / strībālādyavapattau ca bāhyānāṃ siddhikāraṇam //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa arthe gavā arthe vā dehatyāgaḥ n upaskṛtaḥ strī bāla ādi avapattau ca bāhyānām siddhi kāraṇam
translated: Abandoning one's body without regard for it for the sake of Brahmins or cows, or in the case of the distress of women, children, and so on, is the cause of success for outsiders.

original: pitā cet putrān vibhajet tasya svecchā svayam upārjite 'rthe //
analyzed: pitā ced putrān vibhajet tasya sva icchā svayam upārjite rthe
translated: If the father divides the sons, he has the right to do so with the wealth earned by himself.

original: paitāmahe tv arthe pitṛputrayos tulyaṃ svāmitvam //
analyzed: paitāmahe tu arthe pitṛ putrayoḥ tulyam svāmi tvam
translated: But in the wealth of the grandfather, the father and the son have equal ownership.

analyzed: pitṛ vibhaktāḥ vibhāga anantara utpannasya bhāgam dadyuḥ
translated: The divided fathers should give a share to one born after the division.

analyzed: a putra dhanam patnī abhigāmi  tad abhāve pitṛ gāmi
translated: The wealth of a sonless man goes to his wife.🔽In the absence of that, it goes to his father.

analyzed: tad abhāve mātṛ gāmi  tad abhāve bhrātṛ gāmi
translated: In the absence of that, it goes to his mother.🔽In the absence of that, it goes to his brother.

analyzed: tad abhāve bhrātṛ putra gāmi  tad abhāve bandhu gāmi  tad abhāve sakulya gāmi
translated: In the absence of that, it goes to his brother's son.🔽In the absence of that, it goes to his relatives.🔽In the absence of that, it goes to his kinsmen.

analyzed: tad abhāve sahādhyāyi gāmi
translated: In the absence of that, it goes to his fellow students.

analyzed: tad abhāve brāhmaṇa dhana varjam rāja gāmi
translated: In the absence of that, except for the wealth of Brahmins, it goes to the king.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa arthaḥ brāhmaṇānām
translated: The wealth of Brahmins belongs to Brahmins.

analyzed: vānaprastha dhanam ācāryaḥ gṛhṇīyāt
translated: The wealth of a forest hermit should be taken by his teacher.

analyzed: śiṣyaḥ vā
translated: Or by his disciple.

original: saṃsṛṣṭinas tu saṃsṛṣṭī sodarasya tu sodaraḥ / dadyād apaharec cāṃśaṃ jātasya ca mṛtasya ca //
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭinaḥ tu saṃsṛṣṭī sodarasya tu sodaraḥ dadyāt apaharet ca aṃśam jātasya ca mṛtasya ca
translated: But in the case of a joint family, the joint family member, or the uterine brother, should give or take a share of the property of one born or dead.

analyzed: pitṛ mātṛ suta bhrātṛ dattam
translated: Given by father, mother, son, or brother.

original: anvādheyakam iti strīdhanam // brāhmādiṣu caturṣu vivāheṣv aprajāyām atītāyāṃ tadbhartuḥ //
analyzed: anvādheyakam iti strīdhanam brāhma ādiṣu caturṣu vivāheṣu aprajāyām atītāyām tad bhartuḥ
translated: The property of a woman is called anvadheyaka (to be added). In the four marriages beginning with Brahma, if the wife dies without issue, that property belongs to her husband.

analyzed: śeṣeṣu ca pitā haret
translated: In the remaining (marriages), the father shall take it.

original: sarveṣv eva prasūtāyāṃ yaddhanaṃ tat duhitṛgāmi //
analyzed: sarveṣu eva prasūtāyām yat dhanam tat duhitṛ gāmi
translated: In all (marriages), if the wife has issue, the property belongs to the daughter.

original: patyau jīvati yaḥ strībhir alaṃkāro dhṛto bhavet /
analyzed: patyau jīvati yaḥ strībhiḥ alaṃkāraḥ dhṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: If any ornament is worn by a woman while her husband is alive,

original: na taṃ bhajeran dāyādā bhajamānāḥ patanti te //
analyzed: na tam bhajeran dāyādāḥ bhajamānāḥ patanti te
translated: her co-parceners shall not share it; if they share it, they fall.

analyzed: aneka pitṛkāṇām tu pitṛtaḥ ṃśa prakalpanā
translated: But in the case of those having many fathers, the shares shall be determined according to the father.

original: yasya yat paitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ sa tad gṛhṇīta netaraḥ // brāhmaṇasya caturṣu varṇeṣu cet putrā bhaveyuḥ / te paitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ daśadhā vibhajeyuḥ //
analyzed: yasya yat paitṛkam riktham sa tat gṛhṇīta na itaraḥ brāhmaṇasya caturṣu varṇeṣu ced putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ te paitṛkam riktham daśadhā vibhajeyuḥ
translated: Each shall take that paternal property which belongs to his father; not another's. If a Brahmana has sons in the four castes, they shall divide the paternal property into ten parts.

analyzed: tatra brāhmaṇī putraḥ caturaḥ ṃśān ādadyāt
translated: There, the son of a Brahmani shall take four parts.

analyzed: kṣatriyā putraḥ trīn
translated: The son of a Kshatriya three parts.

analyzed: dvau aṃśau vaiśyā putraḥ
translated: The son of a Vaishya two parts.

analyzed: śūdrā putraḥ tu ekam
translated: The son of a Shudra one part.

original: atha cet śūdravarjaṃ brāhmaṇasya putratrayaṃ bhavet / tadā taddhanaṃ navadhā vibhajeyuḥ //
analyzed: atha ced śūdra varjam brāhmaṇasya putra trayam bhavet tadā tad dhanam navadhā vibhajeyuḥ
translated: But if a Brahmana has three sons excluding a Shudra, then they shall divide the property into nine parts.

analyzed: catur tri dvi bhāgīkṛtān aṃśān ādadyuḥ
translated: They should take shares in the order of their castes, the eldest taking four parts, the middle one three, and the youngest two.

original: vaiśyavarjam aṣṭadhā kṛtaṃ caturas trīn ekaṃ cādadyuḥ //
analyzed: vaiśya varjam aṣṭadhā kṛtam caturaḥ trīn ekam ca ādadyuḥ
translated: Excepting the Vaiśya, when the property is divided into eight parts, they should take four, three, and one part respectively.

original: kṣatriyavarjam saptadhā kṛtaṃ caturo dvāv ekaṃ ca //
analyzed: kṣatriya varjam saptadhā kṛtam caturaḥ dvau ekam ca
translated: Excepting the Kṣatriya, when the property is divided into seven parts, they should take four, two, and one part respectively.

original: brāhmaṇavarjaṃ ṣaḍdhā kṛtaṃ trīn dvāv ekaṃ ca //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa varjam ṣaḍdhā kṛtam trīn dvau ekam ca
translated: Excepting the Brāhmaṇa, when the property is divided into six parts, they should take three, two, and one part respectively.

analyzed: kṣatriyasya kṣatriyā vaiśyā śūdrā putreṣu ayam eva vibhāgaḥ
translated: This same division holds good in the case of the sons of the Kṣatriya, born of a Kṣatriya, a Vaiśya, and a Śūdra wife.

analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya brāhmaṇa kṣatriyau putrau syātām
translated: Now, if the Brāhmaṇa has two sons, a Brāhmaṇa and a Kṣatriya.

original: tadā saptadhā kṛtād dhanād brāhmaṇaś caturo 'ṃśān ādadyāt //
analyzed: tadā saptadhā kṛtāt dhanāt brāhmaṇaḥ caturaḥ ṃśān ādadyāt
translated: Then, out of the property divided into seven parts, the Brāhmaṇa son should take four parts.

analyzed: trīn rājanyaḥ
translated: The Kṣatriya son should take three parts.

analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya brāhmaṇa vaiśyau
translated: Now, if the Brāhmaṇa has two sons, a Brāhmaṇa and a Vaiśya.

original: tadā ṣaḍdhā vibhaktasya caturo 'ṃśān brāhmaṇas tv ādadyāt //
analyzed: tadā ṣaḍdhā vibhaktasya caturaḥ ṃśān brāhmaṇaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: Then, out of the property divided into six parts, the Brāhmaṇa son should take four parts.

analyzed: dvau aṃśau vaiśyaḥ
translated: The Vaiśya son should take two parts.

original: atha brāhmaṇasya brāhmaṇaśūdrau putrau syātāṃ / tadā taddhanam pañcadhā vibhajeyātām //
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya brāhmaṇa śūdrau putrau syātām tadā tad dhanam pañcadhā vibhajeyātām
translated: Now, if the Brāhmaṇa has two sons, a Brāhmaṇa and a Śūdra. They should divide that property into five parts.

analyzed: caturaḥ ṃśān brāhmaṇaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: The Brāhmaṇa son should take four parts.

analyzed: ekam śūdraḥ
translated: The Śūdra son should take one part.

original: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vā kṣatriyavaiśyau putrau syātāṃ / tadā taddhanaṃ pañcadhā vibhajeyātām //
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vā kṣatriya vaiśyau putrau syātām tadā tad dhanam pañcadhā vibhajeyātām
translated: Now, if the son of a Brahmin or a Kshatriya is a Kshatriya or a Vaishya, they should divide his property into five parts.

analyzed: trīn aṃśān kṣatriyaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: The Kshatriya should take three parts.

original: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vā kṣatriyaśūdrau putrau syātāṃ / tadā taddhanaṃ caturdhā vibhajeyātām //
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vā kṣatriya śūdrau putrau syātām tadā tad dhanam caturdhā vibhajeyātām
translated: Now, if the son of a Brahmin or a Kshatriya is a Kshatriya or a Shudra, they should divide his property into four parts.

analyzed: trīn aṃśān kṣatriyaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: The Kshatriya should take three parts.

analyzed: ekam śūdraḥ
translated: The Shudra one part.

original: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vaiśyasya vā vaiśyaśūdrau putrau syātāṃ / tadā taddhanaṃ tridhā vibhajeyātām //
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya vaiśyasya vā vaiśya śūdrau putrau syātām tadā tad dhanam tridhā vibhajeyātām
translated: Now, if the son of a Brahmin, Kshatriya, or Vaishya is a Vaishya or a Shudra, they should divide his property into three parts.

analyzed: dvau aṃśau vaiśyaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: The Vaishya should take two parts.

analyzed: ekam śūdraḥ
translated: The Shudra one part.

analyzed: atha eka putrāḥ brāhmaṇasya brāhmaṇa kṣatriya vaiśyāḥ sarva harāḥ  kṣatriyasya rājanya vaiśyau
translated: Now, if a Brahmin has only one son, he may take the entire property of a Brahmin, Kshatriya, or Vaishya.

analyzed: vaiśyasya vaiśyaḥ
translated: If a Kshatriya has only one son, he may take the entire property of a Kshatriya or a Vaishya.🔽If a Vaishya has only one son, he may take the entire property of a Vaishya.

analyzed: śūdraḥ śūdrasya
translated: If a Shudra has only one son, he may take the entire property of a Shudra.

original: dvijātīnāṃ śūdras tv ekaḥ putro 'rdhaharaḥ // aputrarikthasya yā gatiḥ /
analyzed: dvijātīnām śūdraḥ tu ekaḥ putraḥ ṛdha haraḥ aputra rikthasya yā gatiḥ
translated: The Shudra is the only son of the twice-born who takes half of the property. The fate of the property of one without a son.

analyzed: mātaraḥ putra bhāga anusāreṇa bhāga apahāriṇyaḥ
translated: The mothers take the shares according to the shares of their sons.

analyzed: anūḍhāḥ ca duhitaraḥ
translated: And unmarried daughters.

analyzed: samāna varṇāḥ putrāḥ samān aṃśān ādadyuḥ
translated: Sons of the same caste shall take equal shares.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāya śreṣṭham uddhāram dadyuḥ
translated: The best share shall be given to the eldest.

original: yadi dvau brāhmaṇīputrau syātām ekaḥ śūdrāputraḥ / tadā navadhā vibhaktasyārthasya brāhmaṇīputrāv aṣṭau bhāgān ādadyātām ekaṃ śūdrāputraḥ //
analyzed: yadi dvau brāhmaṇī putrau syātām ekaḥ śūdrā putraḥ tadā navadhā vibhaktasya arthasya brāhmaṇī putrau aṣṭau bhāgān ādadyātām ekam śūdrā putraḥ
translated: If there are two sons of a Brahmin wife and one son of a Shudra wife, then of the property divided into nine parts, the sons of the Brahmin wife shall take eight parts and the son of the Shudra wife one part.

original: atha śūdrāputrāv ubhau syātām eko brāhmaṇīputraḥ /
analyzed: atha śūdrā putrau ubhau syātām ekaḥ brāhmaṇī putraḥ
translated: If there are two sons of a Shudra wife and one son of a Brahmin wife,

original: tadā ṣaḍdhā vibhaktasyārthasya caturo 'ṃśān brāhmaṇas tv ādadyāt /
analyzed: tadā ṣaḍdhā vibhaktasya arthasya caturaḥ ṃśān brāhmaṇaḥ tu ādadyāt
translated: then of the property divided into six parts, the Brahmin son shall take four parts.

analyzed: dvau aṃśau śūdrā putrau
translated: The two sons of the Shudra wife shall take two parts.

analyzed: anena krameṇa anyatra api aṃśa kalpanā bhavati
translated: In this way, the division of shares is done in other cases also.

original: vibhaktāḥ saha jīvanto vibhajeran punar yadi / samas tatra vibhāgaḥ syāj jyaiṣṭhyaṃ tatra na vidyate //🔽anupaghnan pitṛdravyaṃ śrameṇa yad upārjayet /
analyzed: vibhaktāḥ saha jīvantaḥ vibhajeran punar yadi samaḥ tatra vibhāgaḥ syāt jyaiṣṭhyam tatra na vidyate  anupaghnan pitṛ dravyam śrameṇa yat upārjayet
translated: If the divided co-parceners living together again divide the property, then the division shall be equal; seniority does not exist there.🔽What he earns by his own labour without injuring the father's property,

original: svayam īhitalabdhaṃ tan nākāmo dātum arhati //
analyzed: svayam īhita labdham tat na akāmaḥ dātum arhati
translated: he is not bound to give of it to the father, if he does not wish to do so.

original: paitṛkaṃ tu yadā dravyam anavāptaṃ yad āpnuyāt / na tat putrair bhajet sārdham akāmaḥ svayam arjitam //
analyzed: paitṛkam tu yadā dravyam anavāptam yat āpnuyāt na tat putraiḥ bhajet sārdham akāmaḥ svayam arjitam
translated: But if he obtains property belonging to his father which he had not obtained before, he shall not divide that with his sons, if he does not wish it, since it is self-acquired.

original: vastraṃ patram alaṃkāraḥ kṛtānnam udakaṃ striyaḥ / yogakṣemaṃ pracāraś ca na vibhājyaṃ ca pustakam //
analyzed: vastram patram alaṃkāraḥ kṛtānnam udakam striyaḥ yogakṣemam pracāraḥ ca na vibhājyam ca pustakam
translated: Clothes, a leaf, ornaments, cooked food, water, women, the means of subsistence, and a book are not to be divided.

analyzed: mṛtam dvijam na śūdreṇa nirhārayet
translated: A dead Brāhmaṇa shall not be carried out by a Śūdra.

analyzed: na śūdram dvijena
translated: Nor a Śūdra by a Brāhmaṇa.

analyzed: pitaram mātaram ca putrāḥ nirhareyuḥ
translated: The sons shall carry out their father and mother.

analyzed: na dvijam pitaram api śūdrāḥ
translated: But not a Brāhmaṇa father by Śūdras.

original: brāhmaṇam anāthaṃ ye brāhmaṇā nirharanti te svargalokabhājaḥ //
analyzed: brāhmaṇam anātham ye brāhmaṇāḥ nirharanti te svarga loka bhājaḥ
translated: Those Brāhmaṇas who carry out a Brāhmaṇa who has no one to look after him go to heaven.

original: nirhṛtya ca bāndhavaṃ pretaṃ saṃṣkṛtyāpradakṣiṇena citām abhigamyāpsu savāsaso nimajjanaṃ kuryuḥ //
analyzed: nirhṛtya ca bāndhavam pretam saṃṣkṛtya a pradakṣiṇena citām abhigamya apsu sa vāsasaḥ nimajjanam kuryuḥ
translated: Having carried out the dead body of a relative, having cremated it, having gone round the funeral pyre on its left side, they shall bathe with their clothes on.

analyzed: pretasya udaka nirvapaṇam kṛtvā ekam piṇḍam kuśeṣu dadyuḥ
translated: Having offered water to the dead person, they shall give one ball of rice on the Kuśa grass.

original: privartitavāsasaś ca nimbapatrāṇi vidaśya dvāry aśmani padanyāsaṃ kṛtvā gṛhaṃ praviśeyuḥ //
analyzed: privartita vāsasaḥ ca nimba patrāṇi vidaśya dvāri aśmani pada nyāsam kṛtvā gṛham praviśeyuḥ
translated: Having changed their clothes and having bitten Nimva leaves, they shall step on a stone at the door and then enter the house.

analyzed: akṣatān ca agnau kṣipeyuḥ
translated: And they shall throw unbroken rice into the fire.

analyzed: caturthe divase sthisaṃcayanam kuryuḥ
translated: On the fourth day, they should collect the bones.

analyzed: teṣām gaṅgā ambhasi prakṣepaḥ
translated: Those bones should be thrown into the waters of the Ganges.

original: yāvat saṃkhyam asthi puruṣasya gaṅgāmbhasi tiṣṭhati / tāvad varṣasahasrāṇi svargalokam adhitiṣṭhati //
analyzed: yāvat saṃkhyam asthi puruṣasya gaṅgā ambhasi tiṣṭhati tāvat varṣa sahasrāṇi svarga lokam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: For as many years as the bones of a man remain in the waters of the Ganges, for so many thousands of years he dwells in the heavenly world.

original: yāvad āśaucaṃ tāvat pretasyodakaṃ piṇḍam ekaṃ ca dadyuḥ //🔽krītalabdhāśanāś ca bhaveyuḥ //
analyzed: yāvat āśaucam tāvat pretasya udakam piṇḍam ekam ca dadyuḥ  krīta labdha aśanāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: For as long as the period of impurity lasts, they should offer water and one ball of rice to the deceased.🔽They should eat what is bought or obtained without effort.

analyzed: a māṃsa aśanāḥ ca  sthaṇḍilaśāyinaḥ
translated: They should not eat meat.🔽They should sleep on the bare ground.

analyzed: pṛthakśāyinaḥ ca
translated: They should sleep separately.

original: grāmān niṣkramyāśaucānte kṛtaśmaśrukarmāṇas tilakalkaiḥ sarṣapakalkair vā snātāḥ parivartitavāsaso gṛhaṃ praviśeyuḥ //
analyzed: grāmāt niṣkramya āśauca ante kṛta śmaśrukarmāṇaḥ tila kalkaiḥ sarṣapa kalkaiḥ vā snātāḥ parivartita vāsasaḥ gṛham praviśeyuḥ
translated: Having gone out of the village, at the end of the period of impurity, having performed the shaving ceremony, having bathed with a paste of sesamum or mustard, having changed their clothes, they should enter the house.

original: tatra śāntiṃ kṛtvā brāhmaṇānāṃ ca pūjanaṃ kuryuḥ //
analyzed: tatra śāntim kṛtvā brāhmaṇānām ca pūjanam kuryuḥ
translated: There, having performed the peace ceremony, they should worship the Brahmins.

analyzed: devāḥ parokṣa devāḥ pratyakṣa devāḥ brāhmāṇāḥ
translated: The gods are the unseen gods. The Brahmins are the seen gods.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ lokāḥ dhāryante
translated: The worlds are sustained by the Brahmins.

analyzed: brāhmaṇānām prasādena divi tiṣṭhanti devatāḥ
translated: By the grace of the Brahmins, the gods dwell in heaven.

original: brāhmaṇābhihitaṃ vākyaṃ na mithyā jāyate kvacit //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa abhihitam vākyam na mithyā jāyate kvacid
translated: The words spoken by the Brahmins never go in vain anywhere.

original: yad brāhmaṇās tuṣṭatamā vadanti tad devatāḥ pratyabhinandayanti /
analyzed: yat brāhmaṇāḥ tuṣṭatamāḥ vadanti tat devatāḥ pratyabhinandayanti
translated: Whatever the Brahmanas speak with the greatest satisfaction, that the gods accept.

original: tuṣṭeṣu tuṣṭāḥ satataṃ bhavanti pratyakṣadeveṣu parokṣadevāḥ //
analyzed: tuṣṭeṣu tuṣṭāḥ satatam bhavanti pratyakṣa deveṣu parokṣa devāḥ
translated: When the Brahmanas are satisfied, the gods, both visible and invisible, are always satisfied.

original: duḥkhānvitānāṃ mṛtabāndhavānām āśvāsanaṃ kuryur adīnasattvāḥ / vākyais tu yair bhūmi tavābhidhāsye vākyāny ahaṃ tāni mano 'bhirāme //
analyzed: duḥkha anvitānām mṛta bāndhavānām āśvāsanam kuryuḥ adīna sattvāḥ vākyaiḥ tu yaiḥ bhūmi tava abhidhāsye vākyāni aham tāni manaḥ abhirāme
translated: Those of depressed spirits should console those who are afflicted with grief and whose relatives are dead, by means of those words which I shall now recite to you, O delighter of the heart.

original: yad uttarāyaṇaṃ tad ahar devānām //🔽dakṣiṇāyanaṃ rātriḥ //
analyzed: yat uttarāyaṇam tat ahar devānām  dakṣiṇāyanam rātriḥ
translated: The period of the sun's northward course is the day of the gods.🔽The period of the sun's southward course is the night of the gods.

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ horātraḥ
translated: The year is the day and night of the gods.

analyzed: tat triṃśatā māsāḥ
translated: Thirty such days make a month.

analyzed: māsāḥ dvādaśa varṣam
translated: Twelve such months make a year.

analyzed: dvādaśa varṣa śatāni divyāni kali yugam
translated: Twelve hundred divine years make the Kali age.

analyzed: dviguṇāni dvāparam triguṇāni tretā
translated: Twice that makes the Dwapara age. Three times that makes the Treta age.

analyzed: caturguṇāni kṛta yugam
translated: Four times that makes the Krita age.

analyzed: dvādaśa varṣa sahasrāṇi divyāni caturyugam
translated: Twelve thousand divine years make a Caturyuga.

analyzed: caturyugāṇām ekasaptatiḥ manvantaram
translated: Seventy-one such Caturyugas make one Manvantara.

analyzed: caturyuga sahasram ca kalpaḥ  sa ca pitāmahasya ahar
translated: One thousand Caturyugas make one Kalpa.🔽That is the day of the Grandsire.

analyzed: tāvatī ca asya rātriḥ
translated: His night is of the same duration.

original: evaṃvidhenāhorātreṇa māsavarṣagaṇanayā sarvasyaiva brahmaṇo varṣaśatam āyuḥ //
analyzed: evaṃvidhena ahorātreṇa māsa varṣa gaṇanayā sarvasya eva brahmaṇaḥ varṣa śatam āyuḥ
translated: By such days and nights, by counting months and years, the life of the entire Brahman is one hundred years.

analyzed: brahma āyuṣā ca paricchinnaḥ pauruṣaḥ divasaḥ
translated: The day of Purusha is limited by the life of Brahman.

analyzed: tasya ante mahākalpaḥ
translated: At the end of that, there is the Great Kalpa.

analyzed: tāvatī eva asya niśā
translated: That much is also his night.

analyzed: paurūṣeyāṇām ahar rātrāṇām atītānām saṃkhyā eva na asti
translated: There is no count of the past days and nights of Purusha.

analyzed: na ca bhaviṣyāṇām
translated: Nor of the future.

analyzed: anādi anta tvāt kālasya
translated: Because time has no beginning or end.

original: evam asmin nirālambe kāle satatayāyini / na tadbhūtaṃ prapaśyāmi sthitir yasya bhaved dhruvā //
analyzed: evam asmin nirālambe kāle satata yāyini na tat bhūtam prapaśyāmi sthitiḥ yasya bhavet dhruvā
translated: Thus, in this time which has no support and is ever-moving, I do not see any being whose existence would be permanent.

original: gaṅgāyāḥ sikatā dhārās tathā varṣati vāsave /
analyzed: gaṅgāyāḥ sikatāḥ dhārāḥ tathā varṣati vāsave
translated: The sand particles of the Ganges, and likewise when Indra rains,

original: caturdaśa vinaśyanti kalpe kalpe sureśvarāḥ / sarvalokapradhānāś ca manavaś ca caturdaśa //
analyzed: caturdaśa vinaśyanti kalpe kalpe sura īśvarāḥ sarva loka pradhānāḥ ca manavaḥ ca caturdaśa
translated: Fourteen perish in each Kalpa, O Lord of the gods, and fourteen Manus, the foremost of all worlds.

original: bahūnīndrasahasrāṇi daityendraniyutāni ca / vinaṣtānīha kālena manujeṣv atha kā kathā //
analyzed: bahūni indra sahasrāṇi daitya indra niyutāni ca  vinaṣtāni iha kālena manujeṣu atha kā kathā
translated: Many thousands of Indras and millions of demon lords have been destroyed by time here. What to speak of humans?

original: rājarṣayaś ca bahavaḥ sarvaiḥ samuditā guṇaiḥ / devā brahmarṣayaś caiva kālena nidhanaṃ gatāḥ //
analyzed: rājarṣayaḥ ca bahavaḥ sarvaiḥ samuditāḥ guṇaiḥ devāḥ brahmarṣayaḥ ca eva kālena nidhanam gatāḥ
translated: Many royal sages, endowed with all virtues, gods and brahmarshis have gone to death by time.

analyzed: ye samarthāḥ jagati asmin sṛṣṭi saṃhāra kāraṇe
translated: Those who are capable in this world of creating and destroying,

original: te 'pi kālena nīyante kālo hi duratikramaḥ //
analyzed: te pi kālena nīyante kālaḥ hi duratikramaḥ
translated: They too are carried away by time, for time is difficult to transgress.

original: ākramya sarvaḥ kālena paralokaṃ ca nīyate / karmapāśavaśo jantus tatra kā paridevanā //
analyzed: ākramya sarvaḥ kālena para lokam ca nīyate karma pāśa vaśaḥ jantuḥ tatra kā paridevanā
translated: Everyone, having been conquered by time, is carried to the other world. The creature, under the control of the noose of karma, there is no lamentation.

original: jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyur dhruvaṃ janma mṛtasya ca / arthe duṣparihārye 'smin nāsti loke sahāyatā //
analyzed: jātasya hi dhruvaḥ mṛtyuḥ dhruvam janma mṛtasya ca  arthe duṣparihārye smin na asti loke sahāya tā
translated: For one who is born, death is certain, and for one who is dead, birth is certain. In this world, which is difficult to avoid, there is no companionship.

original: śocanto nopakurvanti mṛtasyeha janā yataḥ / ato na roditavyaṃ hi kriyā kāryā svaśaktitaḥ //
analyzed: śocantaḥ nā upakurvanti mṛtasya iha janāḥ yatas atas na roditavyam hi kriyā kāryā sva śaktitaḥ
translated: Since people here do not help the dead by lamenting, therefore one should not weep, but perform the rites to the best of one's ability.

original: sukṛtaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ cobhau sahāyau yasya gacchataḥ / bāndhavais tasya kiṃ kāryaṃ śocadbhir atha vā na vā //
analyzed: sukṛtam duṣkṛtam ca ubhau sahāyau yasya gacchataḥ bāndhavaiḥ tasya kim kāryam śocadbhiḥ atha vā na vā
translated: Both good deeds and bad deeds are the companions of one who goes. What is the use of relatives, whether they lament or not?

original: arvāk sapiṇdīkaraṇāt preto bhavati yo mṛtaḥ /🔽pitṛlokagataś cānnaṃ śrāddhe bhuṅkte svadhāsamam /🔽pitṛlokagatasyāsya tasmāc chrāddhaṃ prayacchata //
analyzed: arvāk sapiṇdīkaraṇāt pretaḥ bhavati yaḥ mṛtaḥ  pitṛ loka gataḥ ca annam śrāddhe bhuṅkte svadhā samam  pitṛ loka gatasya asya tasmāt śrāddham prayacchata
translated: One who has died before the sapindīkaraṇa becomes a preta.🔽And one who has gone to the world of the ancestors eats the food in the śrāddha equal to svadhā.🔽Therefore, offer the śrāddha to him who has gone to the world of the ancestors.

original: mānuṣye ca tathāpnoti śrāddhaṃ dattaṃ svabāndhavaiḥ //
analyzed: mānuṣye ca tathā āpnoti śrāddham dattam sva bāndhavaiḥ
translated: And in the human world, he obtains the śrāddha offered by his relatives.

original: pretasya śrāddhakartuś ca puṣṭiḥ śrāddhe kṛte dhruvam / tasmāc chrāddhaṃ sadā kāryaṃ śokaṃ tyaktvā nirarthakam //
analyzed: pretasya śrāddha kartuḥ ca puṣṭiḥ śrāddhe kṛte dhruvam tasmāt śrāddham sadā kāryam śokam tyaktvā nirarthakam
translated: The departed one and the performer of the funeral rites are both sure to prosper if the funeral rites are performed. Therefore, the funeral rites should always be performed, casting off useless grief.

original: etāvad eva kartavyaṃ sadā pretasya bandhubhiḥ /
analyzed: etāvat eva kartavyam sadā pretasya bandhubhiḥ
translated: This much should always be done by the kinsmen of the departed one.

original: nopakuryān naraḥ śocan pretasyātmana eva ca //
analyzed: na upakuryāt naraḥ śocan pretasya ātmanaḥ eva ca
translated: A man grieving does not benefit the departed one or himself.

original: dṛṣṭvā lokam anākrandaṃ mriyamāṇāṃś ca bāndhavān / dharmam ekaṃ sahāyārthaṃ varayadhvaṃ sadā narāḥ //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā lokam an ākrandam mriyamāṇān ca bāndhavān  dharmam ekam sahāya artham varayadhvam sadā narāḥ
translated: Seeing the world to be without a protector, and kinsmen dying, men should always choose righteousness as their sole companion.

original: mṛto 'pi bāndhavaḥ śakto nānugantuṃ naraṃ mṛtam / jāyāvarjaṃ hi sarvasya yāmyaḥ panthā virudhyate //
analyzed: bāndhavaḥ śaktaḥ na anugantum naram mṛtam  jāyā varjam hi sarvasya yāmyaḥ panthāḥ virudhyate
translated: Even a dead kinsman is not able to follow a dead man. The path of Yama is obstructed for all except the wife.

original: dharma eko 'nuyāty enaṃ yatra kvacana gāminam /
analyzed: dharmaḥ ekaḥ nuyāti enam yatra kvacana gāminam
translated: Righteousness alone follows him wherever he goes.

original: nanv asāre nṛloke 'smin dharmaṃ kuruta mā ciram //
analyzed: nanu asāre nṛ loke smin dharmam kuruta mā ciram
translated: Therefore, in this worthless human world, perform righteous acts, and do not delay.

original: śvaḥ kāryam adya kurvīta pūrvāhṇe cāparāhṇikam /
analyzed: śvas kāryam adya kurvīta pūrvāhṇe ca āparāhṇikam
translated: One should do tomorrow's work today, and the afternoon's work in the forenoon.

original: na hi pratīkṣate mṛtyuḥ kṛtaṃ vāsya na vākṛtam //
analyzed: na hi pratīkṣate mṛtyuḥ kṛtam vā asya na vā a kṛtam
translated: For death does not wait to see if his work is done or not done.

original: kṣetrāpaṇagṛhāsaktam anyatra gatamānasam / vṛkīvoraṇam āsādya mṛtyur ādāya gacchati //
analyzed: kṣetra āpaṇa gṛha āsaktam anyatra gata mānasam vṛkī iva uraṇam āsādya mṛtyuḥ ādāya gacchati
translated: Death, like a she-wolf, seizes and carries away a man whose mind is elsewhere, though he be engaged in his field, shop or house.

original: na kālasya priyaḥ kaścid dveṣyaś cāsya na vidyate / āyuṣye karmaṇi kṣīṇe prasahya harate janam //
analyzed: na kālasya priyaḥ kaścid dveṣyaḥ ca asya na vidyate āyuṣye karmaṇi kṣīṇe prasahya harate janam
translated: No one is dear to Death, nor is there anyone who is hated by him. When the life-span of a person is exhausted, he forcibly takes away that person.

analyzed: na aprāpta kālaḥ mriyate viddhaḥ śara śataiḥ api
translated: One whose time has not come does not die even if pierced by hundreds of arrows.

analyzed: kuśa agreṇa api saṃṣpṛṣṭaḥ prāpta kālaḥ na jīvati
translated: One whose time has come does not live even if touched by the tip of a blade of grass.

original: nauśadhāni na mantrāś ca na homā na punar japāḥ / trāyante mṛtyunopetaṃ jarayā vāpi mānavam //
analyzed: nauśadhāni na mantrāḥ ca na homāḥ na punar japāḥ trāyante mṛtyunā upetam jarayā vā api mānavam
translated: Medicines, mantras, oblations, and recitations do not save a man from death or old age.

analyzed: āgāminam anartham hi pravidhāna śataiḥ api
translated: Even with hundreds of measures, one cannot prevent an impending calamity.

original: na nivārayituṃ śaktas tatra kā paridevanā //
analyzed: na nivārayitum śaktaḥ tatra kā paridevanā
translated: What is the use of lamenting there?

original: yathā dhenusahasreṣu vatso vindati mātaram / tathā pūrvakṛtaṃ karma kartāraṃ vindate dhruvam //
analyzed: yathā dhenu sahasreṣu vatsaḥ vindati mātaram tathā pūrva kṛtam karma kartāram vindate dhruvam
translated: Just as a calf finds its mother among a thousand cows, so does one's own past action surely find the doer.

analyzed: avyakta ādīni bhūtāni vyakta madhyāni ca api atha
translated: Beings have an unmanifest beginning, a manifest middle, and an unmanifest end.

original: dehino 'smin yathā dehe kaumāraṃ yauvanaṃ jarā /
analyzed: dehinaḥ u smin yathā dehe kaumāram yauvanam jarā
translated: Just as in this body, there is childhood, youth, and old age,

original: tahtā dehāntaraprāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati //
analyzed: deha antara prāptiḥ dhīraḥ tatra na muhyati
translated: so also there is the attainment of another body. The wise one is not deluded about this.

original: gṛhṇātīha yathā vastraṃ tyaktvā pūrvadhṛtaṃ naraḥ / gṛhṇāty evaṃ navaṃ dehī dehaṃ karmanibandhanam //
analyzed: gṛhṇāti iha yathā vastram tyaktvā pūrva dhṛtam naraḥ gṛhṇāti evam navam dehī deham karma nibandhanam
translated: As a man takes up a new garment, leaving off the one he had on, even so the embodied soul takes up a new body, in consequence of its acts.

original: nainaṃ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṃ dahati pāvakaḥ / na cainaṃ kledayanty āpo na śoṣayati mārutaḥ //
analyzed: na enam chindanti śastrāṇi na enam dahati pāvakaḥ na ca enam kledayanti āpaḥ na śoṣayati mārutaḥ
translated: Weapons do not cut it, fire does not burn it, water does not moisten it, and wind does not dry it up.

analyzed: acchedyaḥ yam a dāhyaḥ yam a kledyaḥ śoṣyaḥ eva ca
translated: It is indivisible, indestructible, incapable of being moistened, and incapable of being dried up.

original: nityaḥ satatagaḥ sthāṇur acalo 'yaṃ sanātanaḥ // avyakto 'yam acintyo 'yam avikāryo 'yam ucyate /
analyzed: nityaḥ satata gaḥ sthāṇuḥ acalaḥ yam sanātanaḥ avyaktaḥ yam acintyaḥ yam avikāryaḥ yam ucyate
translated: It is eternal, all-pervading, firm, unmoving, and ancient. It is said to be unmanifest, inconceivable, and immutable.

analyzed: tasmāt evam viditvā enam na anuśocitum arhatha
translated: Therefore, knowing it thus, you should not grieve.

original: athāśaucavyapagame susnātaḥ suprakṣālitapāṇipādaḥ svācāntas tv evaṃvidhān eva brāhmaṇān yathāśakti udaṅmukhān gandhamālyavastrālaṃkārādibhiḥ pūjitān bhojayet //
analyzed: atha aśauca vyapagame su snātaḥ su prakṣālita pāṇi pādaḥ su ācāntaḥ tu evaṃvidhān eva brāhmaṇān yathāśakti udak mukhān gandha mālya vastra alaṃkāra ādibhiḥ  / pūjitān bhojayet
translated: Then, when the impurity is over, having bathed well and washed the hands and feet well, having sipped water, one should feed such Brahmins only, facing north, who are worshipped with perfumes, garlands, clothes, ornaments, etc., to the best of one's ability.

original: ekavanmantrān ūhed ekoddiṣṭe // ucchiṣṭasaṃnidhāv ekam eva tannāmagotrābhyāṃ piṇḍaṃ nirvapet //
analyzed: ekavat mantrān ūhet ekoddiṣṭe ucchiṣṭa saṃnidhau ekam eva tad nāma gotrābhyām piṇḍam nirvapet
translated: One should recite the mantras as if they were one, in the Ekoddista. In the presence of the remnants, one should offer one ball only, with his name and gotra.

original: bhuktavatsu brāhmaṇeṣu dakṣiṇayābhipūjiteṣu pretanāmagotrābhyāṃ dattākṣayyodakaḥ caturaṅgulapṛthvīḥ tāvadantarāḥ tāvadadhaḥkhātāḥ vitastyāyatāḥ 🔽tisraḥ karṣūḥ kuryāt //
analyzed: bhuktavatsu brāhmaṇeṣu dakṣiṇayā abhipūjiteṣu preta nāma gotrābhyām datta akṣayya udakaḥ catur aṅgula pṛthvīḥ tāvat antarāḥ tāvat adhas khātāḥ vitasti āyatāḥ  / tisraḥ karṣūḥ kuryāt
translated: After the Brahmins have eaten and have been honored with gifts, having offered water for the sake of the deceased, mentioning his name and gotra, he should make three trenches, three fingers wide, that much apart, and that much deep,🔽and extending a Vitasti (about 12 inches).

original: karṣūsamīpe cāgnitrayam upasamādhāya paristīrya tatraikaikasmin āhutitrayaṃ juhuyāt //
analyzed: karṣū samīpe ca agnitrayam upasamādhāya paristīrya tatra ekaikasmin āhuti trayam juhuyāt
translated: And having kindled three fires near the trenches, and strewed (Darbha grass) around, he should offer three oblations into each of them.

original: somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ //🔽agnaye kavyavāhanāya svathā namaḥ //
analyzed: somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ  agnaye kavyavāhanāya svathā namaḥ
translated: To Soma together with the Pitrs, Svâhâ! adoration!🔽To Agni, the carrier of oblations, Svâhâ! adoration!

original: yamāyāṅgirase svadhā namaḥ //🔽sthānatraye ca prāgvat piṇḍanirvapaṇaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: yamāya aṅgirase svadhā namaḥ  sthāna traye ca prāgvat piṇḍa nirvapaṇam kuryāt
translated: To Yama, the son of Vivasvat, Svâhâ! adoration!🔽And in the three places he should offer the Pindas as before.

original: annadadhighṛtamadhumāṃsaiḥ karṣūtrayaṃ pūrayitvā etat ta iti japet //
analyzed: anna dadhi ghṛta madhu māṃsaiḥ karṣū trayam pūrayitvā etat te iti japet
translated: Having filled the three trenches with food, curd, ghee, honey, and meat, he should murmur, This is thine.

analyzed: evam mṛta ahe pratimāsam kuryāt
translated: Thus he should do every month on the anniversary of the death (of the deceased).

original: saṃvatsarānte pretāya tatpitre tatpitāmahāya tatprapitāmahāya ca brāhmaṇān devapūrvān bhojayet //
analyzed: saṃvatsara ante pretāya tad pitre tad pitāmahāya tad prapitāmahāya ca brāhmaṇān deva pūrvān bhojayet
translated: At the end of a year he should feed Brahmanas, beginning with those who are invited, for the sake of the deceased, of his father, of his grandfather, and of his great-grandfather.

analyzed: atra agnaukaraṇam āvāhanam pādyam ca kuryāt
translated: Here he should perform the rite of kindling the fires, the invocation (of the deceased), and the offering of water for washing the feet.

original: saṃsṛjatu tvā pṛthivī samānī ca iti ca pretapādyapātre pitṛpādyapātratraye yojayet //
analyzed: saṃsṛjatu tvā pṛthivī samānī ca iti ca preta pādya pātre pitṛ pādya pātra traye yojayet
translated: He should then mix the water from the foot-washing vessel with the water from the three vessels containing water for the feet of the ancestors, with the formula, May the earth unite thee with thy own.

analyzed: ucchiṣṭa saṃnidhau piṇḍa catuṣṭayam kuryāt
translated: In the presence of the leavings of food, he should make four balls of food.

original: brāhmaṇāṃś ca svācāntān dattadakṣiṇāṃś cānuvrajya visarjayet //
analyzed: brāhmaṇān ca su ācāntān datta dakṣiṇān ca anuvrajya visarjayet
translated: Having followed the Brahmanas who have eaten well and to whom presents have been given, he should dismiss them.

analyzed: tatas preta piṇḍam pādya pātra udaka vat piṇḍa traye nidadhyāt
translated: Then he should place the ball of food for the deceased, like the water from the foot-washing vessel, in the three balls of food.

analyzed: karṣū traya saṃnikrṣe pi evam eva
translated: The same should be done in the case of the three furrows also.

original: sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ māsikārthavat dvādaśāhaṃ śrāddhaṃ kṛtvā trayodaśe 'hni vā kuryāt //
analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇam māsikārthavat dvādaśa aham śrāddham kṛtvā trayodaśe hni vā kuryāt
translated: The Sapindikarana should be performed after having performed the Sraddha on the twelfth day, or on the thirteenth day.

analyzed: mantra varjam hi śūdrāṇām dvādaśe hni
translated: For Sudras, it should be done on the twelfth day without Mantras.

original: saṃvatsarābhyantare yady adhimāso bhavet / tadā māsikārthe dinam ekaṃ vardhayet //
analyzed: saṃvatsara abhyantare yadi adhimāsaḥ bhavet tadā māsika arthe dinam ekam vardhayet
translated: If an intercalary month occurs within a year, then in the monthly Sraddha, one day should be added.

original: sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ strīṇāṃ kāryam evaṃ tathā bhavet / yāvaj jīvaṃ tathā kuryāc chrāddhaṃ tu prativatsaram //
analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇam strīṇām kāryam evam tathā bhavet yāvat jīvam tathā kuryāt śrāddham tu prati vatsaram
translated: The Sapindikarana of women should be done in the same way. It should be done as long as one lives, and the Sraddha should be performed every year.

original: arvāk sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ yasya saṃvatsarāt kṛtaṃ / tasyāpy annaṃ sodakumbhaṃ dadyād varṣaṃ dvijanmane //
analyzed: arvāk sapiṇḍīkaraṇam yasya saṃvatsarāt kṛtam tasya api annam sa udakumbham dadyāt varṣam dvijanmane
translated: For him whose Sapindikarana has been done before a year, one should give food with a water-pot for a year to a twice-born person.

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya sapiṇḍānām janana maraṇayoḥ daśa aham āśaucam
translated: For a Brahmin, the impurity lasts for ten days in the case of the birth or death of a Sapinda (i.e., a person related by an unbroken line of ancestry).

analyzed: dvādaśa aham rājanyasya
translated: For a Kshatriya, it lasts for twelve days.

analyzed: pañcadaśa aham vaiśyasya
translated: For a Vaishya, it lasts for fifteen days.

analyzed: māsam śūdrasya
translated: For a Shudra, it lasts for one month.

analyzed: sapiṇḍa tā ca puruṣe saptame vinivartate
translated: The Sapinda relationship ceases with the seventh person in the male line.

analyzed: āśauce homa dāna pratigraha svādhyāyāḥ nivartante
translated: Homa, giving gifts, receiving gifts, and studying are suspended during impurity.

analyzed: na āśauce kasyacid annam aśnīyāt
translated: One should not eat the food of anyone during impurity.

original: brāhmaṇādīnām aśauce yaḥ sakṛd evānnam atti tasya tāvad āśaucaṃ yāvat teṣām //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādīnām aśauce yaḥ sakṛt eva annam atti tasya tāvat āśaucam yāvat teṣām
translated: If one eats the food of a Brahmin etc. even once during their impurity, his impurity lasts as long as theirs.

analyzed: āśauśa apagame prāyaścittam kuryāt
translated: When the impurity is over, one should perform the expiation.

original: savarṇasyāśauce dvijo bhuktvā sravantīm āsādya tannimagnas triraghamarṣaṇaṃ japtvottīrya gāyatryaṣṭasahasraṃ japet //
analyzed: sa varṇasya āśauce dvijaḥ bhuktvā sravantīm āsādya tad nimagnaḥ tris aghamarṣaṇam japtvā uttīrya gāyatrī aṣṭa sahasram japet
translated: If a Brahmin eats the food of a person of the same class during their impurity, he should go to a river, immerse himself in it, recite the Aghamarshana three times, come out, and recite the Gayatri one thousand and eight times.

original: kṣatriyāśauce brāhmaṇas tv etad evopoṣitaḥ kṛtvā śudhyati //
analyzed: kṣatriya āśauce brāhmaṇaḥ tu etat eva upoṣitaḥ kṛtvā śudhyati
translated: If a Brahmin eats the food of a Kshatriya during their impurity, he becomes pure by doing the same thing and fasting.

analyzed: vaiśya āśauce rājanyaḥ ca
translated: If a Kshatriya eats the food of a Vaishya during their impurity, he becomes pure by doing the same thing.

analyzed: vaiśya āśauce brāhmaṇaḥ tri rātra upoṣitaḥ ca
translated: If a Brahmin eats the food of a Vaishya during their impurity, he becomes pure by fasting for three nights.

original: brāhmaṇāśauce rājanyaḥ kṣatriyāśauce vaiśyaś ca sravantīm āsādya gāyatrīśatapañcakaṃ japet //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa āśauce rājanyaḥ kṣatriya āśauce vaiśyaḥ ca sravantīm āsādya gāyatrī śata pañcakam japet
translated: If a Kshatriya eats the food of a Brahmin or a Vaishya during their impurity, he should go to a river, recite the Gayatri one hundred and five times,

original: vaiśyaś ca brāhmaṇāśauce gāyatryaṣṭaśataṃ japet //🔽śūdrāśauce dvijo bhuktvā prājāpatyaṃ caret //
analyzed: vaiśyaḥ ca brāhmaṇa āśauce gāyatrī aṣṭaśatam japet  śūdra āśauce dvijaḥ bhuktvā prājāpatyam caret
translated: And a Vaisya, when a Brahmana is impure, should mutter the Gayatri one hundred and eight times.🔽If a twice-born person eats food from a Sudra who is impure, he should perform a Prajapatya penance.

analyzed: śūdraḥ ca dvija āśauce snānam ācaret
translated: And a Sudra, when twice-born persons are impure, should bathe.

analyzed: śūdraḥ śūdra āśauce snātaḥ pañcagavyam pibet
translated: And a Sudra, when a Sudra is impure, having bathed, should drink Panchagavya.

original: patnīnāṃ dāsānām ānulomyena svāminas tulyam āśaucam //
analyzed: patnīnām dāsānām ānulomyena svāminaḥ tulyam āśaucam
translated: The impurity of wives and slaves is the same as that of their masters, in accordance with their order.

analyzed: mṛte svāmini ātmīyam
translated: When the master dies, it is their own (impurity).

original: hīnavarṇānām adhikavarṇeṣu sapiṇḍeṣu tadaśaucavyapagame śuddhiḥ //🔽brāhmaṇasya kṣatriviṭśūdreṣu sapiṇḍeṣu ṣaḍrātratrirātraikarātraiḥ //
analyzed: hīna varṇānām adhika varṇeṣu sapiṇḍeṣu tad aśauca vyapagame śuddhiḥ  brāhmaṇasya kṣatri viś śūdreṣu sapiṇḍeṣu ṣaṣ rātra tri rātra eka rātraiḥ
translated: The purification of the lower castes is when the impurity of the higher castes, their Sapindas, has passed.🔽For a Brahmana, when Kshatriyas, Vaisyas, and Sudras are his Sapindas, it is after six, three, and one night.

analyzed: kṣatriyasya viś śūdrayoḥ ṣaṣ rātra tri rātrābhyām
translated: For a Kshatriya, when Vaisyas and Sudras are his Sapindas, it is after six and three nights.

analyzed: vaiśyasya śūdreṣu ṣaṣ rātreṇa
translated: For a Vaisya, when Sudras are his Sapindas, it is after six nights.

original: māsatulyair ahorātrair garbhasrāve //🔽jātamṛte mṛtajāte vā kulasya sadyaḥ śaucam //
analyzed: māsa tulyaiḥ ahar rātraiḥ garbhasrāve  jāta mṛte mṛta jāte vā kulasya sadyas śaucam
translated: In the case of miscarriage, it is after as many days and nights as months have elapsed.🔽If a child dies immediately after birth, or if a stillborn child is born, the family becomes pure immediately.

analyzed: a danta jāte bāle prete sadyas eva
translated: If a child dies before the appearance of teeth, it is immediately (pure).

original: nāsyāgnisaṃskāro nodakakriyā //🔽dantajāte tv akṛtacūḍe tv ahorātreṇa //
analyzed: na asya agnisaṃskāraḥ na udakakriyā  danta jāte tu a kṛta cūḍe tu ahar rātreṇa
translated: There is no cremation of it, nor any water rite.🔽If the child has teeth but the tonsure has not been performed, it is after one day and night.

analyzed: kṛtacūḍe tu a saṃskṛte tri rātreṇa
translated: If the tonsure has been performed but the sacraments have not been performed, it is after three nights.

analyzed: tatas param yathā ukta kālena  strīṇām vivāhaḥ saṃskāraḥ
translated: After that, at the time mentioned.🔽Marriage is the sacrament for women.

analyzed: saṃskṛtāsu strīṣu na āśaucam pitṛ pakṣe
translated: There is no impurity on the father's side for women who have undergone the sacrament.

original: tatprasavamaraṇe cet pitṛgṛhe syātāṃ / tadā ekarātraṃ trirātraṃ ca //
analyzed: tad prasava maraṇe ced pitṛ gṛhe syātām tadā eka rātram tri rātram ca
translated: If childbirth or death occurs in the father's house, then one night and three nights.

original: jananāśaucamadhye yady aparaṃ jananāśaucaṃ syāt / tadā pūrvāśaucavyapagame śuddhiḥ //
analyzed: janana āśauca madhye yadi aparam janana āśaucam syāt tadā pūrva āśauca vyapagame śuddhiḥ
translated: If another childbirth impurity occurs in the middle of a childbirth impurity, then purification is after the previous impurity is over.
If it is the remainder of a night, then in two days.

analyzed: prabhāte dina trayeṇa
translated: If it is at dawn, then in three days.

analyzed: maraṇa āśauca madhye jñāti maraṇe pi evam
translated: Similarly, if there is a death of a relative in the middle of a death impurity.

analyzed: śrutvā deśa antara sthaḥ janana maraṇe āśauca śeṣeṇa śudhyet
translated: If one hears of a childbirth or death while staying in another country, one becomes pure with the remainder of the impurity.

analyzed: vyatīte śauce saṃvatsara antar tu eka rātreṇa
translated: If the impurity has passed, then within a year with one night.

analyzed: tatas param snānena
translated: After that, with a bath.

analyzed: ācārye mātāmahe ca vyatīte tri rātreṇa
translated: And with three nights if the teacher or maternal grandfather has passed away.

original: anauraseṣu putreṣu jāteṣu ca mṛteṣu ca / parapūrvāsu bhāryāsu prasūtāsu mṛtāsu ca //
analyzed: anauraseṣu putreṣu jāteṣu ca mṛteṣu ca parapūrvāsu bhāryāsu prasūtāsu mṛtāsu ca
translated: And with one night if non-uterine sons are born or die, or if wives from other families give birth or die,

analyzed: ācārya patnī putra upādhyāya mātula śvaśura śvaśurya saha adhyāyi śiṣyeṣu atīteṣu eka rātreṇa
translated: And if the wife, son, teacher, maternal uncle, mother-in-law, father-in-law, fellow student, or disciple of the teacher has passed away,

analyzed: asapiṇḍe sva veśmani mṛte ca
translated: And if someone who is not a Sapinda dies in one's own house.

analyzed: bhṛgu agni anāśaka ambu saṃgrāma vidyut nṛpa hatānām na āśaucam
translated: There is no impurity for those killed by Bhrigu, fire, water, battle, lightning, or a king.

analyzed: na rājñām raja karmaṇi  na vratinām vrate
translated: Not for kings in their royal duties,🔽not for those on vows in their vows,

analyzed: na kārūṇām kāru karmaṇi
translated: not for artisans in their craft,

analyzed: na rāja ājñā kāriṇām tad icchayā
translated: not for those who carry out royal orders at their behest,

analyzed: na deva pratiṣṭhā vivāhayoḥ pūrva saṃbhṛtayoḥ
translated: not for the pre-arranged installation of gods and marriages,

analyzed: na deśa vibhrame
translated: not in the confusion of a country,

analyzed: āpadi api ca kaṣṭāyām
translated: not even in a difficult calamity,

analyzed: ātmatyāginaḥ patitāḥ ca na āśauca udaka bhājaḥ
translated: those who commit suicide and outcasts do not partake of the water of impurity.

original: patitasya dāsī mṛte 'hni padā apāṃ ghaṭam apavarjayet //
analyzed: patitasya dāsī mṛte hni padā apām ghaṭam apavarjayet
translated: If a slave of an outcast dies, she should discard the water pot with her foot on the same day.

original: udbandhanamṛtasya yaḥ pāśaṃ chindyāt sa taptakṛcchreṇa śudhyati //
analyzed: udbandhana mṛtasya yaḥ pāśam chindyāt sa taptakṛcchreṇa śudhyati
translated: One who cuts the noose of one who has died by hanging is purified by a Tapta Krichchhra penance.

analyzed: ātmatyāginām saṃskartā ca
translated: And one who performs the funeral rites for those who commit suicide,

analyzed: tad aśrupāta kārī ca
translated: and one who sheds tears over them,

original: sarvasyaiva pretasya bāndhavaiḥ sahāśrupātaṃ kṛtvā snānena //
analyzed: sarvasya eva pretasya bāndhavaiḥ saha aśrupātam kṛtvā snānena
translated: all the relatives of the deceased, having shed tears, are purified by bathing.

analyzed: a kṛte sthisaṃcaye sa caila snānena
translated: If the bones have not been collected, by bathing with clothes on.

original: dvijaḥ śūdrapretānugamanaṃ kṛtvā sravantīm āsādya tannimagnaḥ triraghamarṣaṇaṃ japtvottīrya gāyatryaṣṭasahasraṃ japet //
analyzed: dvijaḥ śūdra preta anugamanam kṛtvā sravantīm āsādya tad nimagnaḥ tris aghamarṣaṇam japtvā uttīrya gāyatrī aṣṭa sahasram japet
translated: A Brahmin who has followed a Shudra's funeral, having reached a flowing river, having immersed himself in it, having muttered the Aghamarshana three times, having come out, should mutter the Gayatri one thousand and eight times.

analyzed: dvija pretasya aṣṭaśatam
translated: For a twice-born person who has died, (the impurity lasts) eight days.

analyzed: śūdraḥ preta anugamanam kṛtvā snānam ācaret
translated: A Śūdra, having followed the dead body, shall bathe.

analyzed: citā dhūma sevane sarve varṇāḥ snānam ācareyuḥ
translated: All the castes shall bathe if they have inhaled the smoke of a funeral pyre.

analyzed: maithune duḥsvapne rudhira upagata kaṇṭhe vamana virekayoḥ ca
translated: (So also) after sexual intercourse, a bad dream, when blood has come out of the throat, and after vomiting and purging.

original: śmaśrukarmaṇi kṛte ca //🔽śavaspṛśaṃ ca spṛṣṭvā rajasvalācaṇḍālayūpāṃś ca //
analyzed: śmaśrukarmaṇi kṛte ca  śava spṛśam ca spṛṣṭvā rajasvalā caṇḍāla yūpān ca
translated: And after the hair on the head and on the body have been cut.🔽And after touching one who has touched a dead body, a woman in her courses, a Caṇḍāla, or a sacrificial post.

analyzed: bhakṣya varjam pañcanakha śavam tad asthi sneham ca
translated: (So also) after touching the dead body of a five-nailed animal, except if it is fit to be eaten, and its fat.

original: sarveṣv eteṣu snāneṣu vastraṃ nāprakṣālitaṃ bibhṛyāt //
analyzed: sarveṣu eteṣu snāneṣu vastram na a prakṣālitam bibhṛyāt
translated: In all these baths, one shall not wear a garment that has not been washed.

analyzed: rajasvalā caturthe hni snānāt śudhyati
translated: And a woman in her courses becomes pure by bathing on the fourth day.

original: rajasvalā hīnavarṇāṃ rajasvalāṃ spṛṣṭvā na tāvad aśnīyāt yāvan na śuddhā //
analyzed: rajasvalā hīna varṇām rajasvalām spṛṣṭvā na tāvat aśnīyāt yāvat na śuddhā
translated: A woman in her courses, having touched a woman in her courses of a lower caste, shall not eat until she is purified.
