analyzed: gṛhe gurau araṇye vā nivasan ātmavān dvijaḥ na a veda vihitām hiṃsām āpadi api samācaret  yā veda vihitā hiṃsā niyatā asmin carācare
translated: A twice-born person who is self-controlled, whether he lives in his own house or with his preceptor or in the forest, should never, even in times of distress, do any injury to any creature that is not sanctioned by the Vedas.🔽That injury to living creatures which is sanctioned by the Vedas, and which is necessary for the due observance of the duties of the four castes and the four modes of life, should be regarded as no injury at all. It is from the Vedas that the duties of all the four castes and modes of life have been declared.

original: ahiṃsām eva tāṃ vidyād vedād dharmo hi nirbabhau //🔽yo 'hiṃsakāni bhūtāni hinasty ātmasukhecchayā / sa jīvaṃś ca mṛtaś caiva na kvacit sukham edhate //
analyzed: ahiṃsām eva tām vidyāt vedāt dharmaḥ hi nirbabhau  yaḥ hiṃsakāni bhūtāni hinasti ātma sukha icchayā sa jīvan ca mṛtaḥ ca eva na kvacid sukham edhate
translated: From the Vedas has shone forth the religion of mercy.🔽He who, from desire of his own happiness, injures those creatures that are not disposed to injure him, never obtains happiness either here or hereafter.

original: yo bandhanavadhakleśān prāṇināṃ na cikīrṣati / sa sarvasya hitaprepsuḥ sukham atyantam aśnute //
analyzed: yaḥ bandhana vadha kleśān prāṇinām na cikīrṣati sa sarvasya hita prepsuḥ sukham atyantam aśnute
translated: He who does not inflict pain on any creature by imprisonment, death, or affliction, and who seeks the good of all creatures, enjoys the highest happiness.

original: yad dhyāyati yat kurute ratiṃ badhnāti yatra ca / tad evāpnoty ayatnena yo hinasti na kiṃcana //
analyzed: yat dhyāyati yat kurute ratim badhnāti yatra ca  tat eva āpnoti ayatnena yaḥ hinasti na kiṃcana
translated: He who does not injure any creature, obtains without effort whatever he thinks of, whatever he does, and whatever he takes delight in.

original: nākṛtvā prāṇināṃ hiṃsāṃ māṃsam utpadyate kvacit / na ca prāṇivadhaḥ svargyas tasmān māṃsaṃ vivarjayet //
analyzed: na a kṛtvā prāṇinām hiṃsām māṃsam utpadyate kvacid na ca prāṇi vadhaḥ svargyaḥ tasmāt māṃsam vivarjayet
translated: Meat can never be produced without the killing of living creatures; and the slaughter of living creatures is not meritorious; therefore one should abstain from meat.

original: samutpattiṃ ca māṃsasya vadhabandhau ca dehinām / prasamīkṣya nivarteta sarvamāṃsasya bhakṣaṇāt //
analyzed: samutpattim ca māṃsasya vadha bandhau ca dehinām prasamīkṣya nivarteta sarva māṃsasya bhakṣaṇāt
translated: Considering the origin of meat, and the bondage and slaughter of living creatures, one should abstain from eating all meat.

original: na bhakṣayati yo māṃsaṃ vidhiṃ hitvā piśācavat / sa loke priyatāṃ yāti vyādhibhiś ca na pīḍyate //
analyzed: na bhakṣayati yaḥ māṃsam vidhim hitvā piśāca vat  sa loke priya tām yāti vyādhibhiḥ ca na pīḍyate
translated: He who, like a Piśāca, eats meat, disregarding the rules (of the Veda), becomes dear to men, and is not afflicted by diseases.

original: anumantā viśasitā nihantā krayavikrayī / saṃskartā copahartā ca khādakaś ceti ghātakāḥ //
analyzed: anumantā viśasitā nihantā kraya vikrayī saṃskartā ca upahartā ca khādakaḥ ca iti ghātakāḥ
translated: The abettor, the butcher, the slayer, the purchaser, the seller, the preparer, the server, and the eater, are all slayers.

original: svamāṃsaṃ paramāṃsena yo vardhayitum icchati / anabhyarcya pitṝn devān na tato 'nyo 'sty apuṇyakṛt //
analyzed: sva māṃsam para māṃsena yaḥ vardhayitum icchati an abhyarcya pitṝn devān na tatas sti apuṇya kṛt
translated: He who wishes to increase his own flesh by the flesh of another, without worshipping the manes and the gods, there is no greater sinner than he.

original: varṣe varṣe 'śvamedhena yo yajeta śataṃ samāḥ / māṃsāni ca na khāded yas tayoḥ puṇyaphalaṃ samam //
analyzed: varṣe varṣe śvamedhena yaḥ yajeta śatam samāḥ māṃsāni ca na khādet yaḥ tayoḥ puṇya phalam samam
translated: He who performs a horse-sacrifice every year for a hundred years, and he who does not eat meat, have equal merit.

original: phalamūlāśanair divyair munyannānāṃ ca bhojanaiḥ / na tat phalam avāpnoti yan māṃsaparivarjanāt //
analyzed: phala mūla aśanaiḥ divyaiḥ muni annānām ca bhojanaiḥ na tat phalam avāpnoti yat māṃsa parivarjanāt
translated: By eating divine fruits and roots and the food of hermits, one does not obtain that fruit which is obtained by abstaining from meat.

original: māṃ sa bhakṣayitāmutra yasya māṃsam ihādmy aham / etan māṃsasya māṃsatvaṃ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: mām sa bhakṣayitā amutra yasya māṃsam iha admi aham etat māṃsasya māṃsa tvam pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: That person will eat me in the next world, whose meat I eat in this world. This is what the wise declare to be the nature of meat.

analyzed: suvarṇa steya kṛt rājñe karma ācakṣāṇaḥ musalam arpayet
translated: One who has stolen gold should offer a pestle to the king, confessing his deed.

analyzed: vadhāt tyāgāt vā prayataḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes pure by death or abandonment.

analyzed: mahāvratam dvādaśa abdāni vā kuryāt
translated: Or he should perform the Mahāvrata for twelve years.

analyzed: nikṣepa apahārī ca
translated: And one who has stolen a deposit.

original: dhānyadhanāpahārī ca kṛcchram abdam // manuṣyastrīkūpakṣetravāpīnām apahāre cāndrāyaṇam //
analyzed: dhānya dhana apahārī ca kṛcchram abdam manuṣya strī kūpa kṣetra vāpīnām apahāre cāndrāyaṇam
translated: And one who has stolen grain and wealth should perform a Kṛcchra for one year. And for stealing a human being, a woman, a well, a field, or a tank, one should perform a lunar penance.

analyzed: dravyāṇām alpa sārāṇām sāṃtapanam
translated: For stealing articles of little value, a Sāntapana.

analyzed: bhakṣya bhojya yāna śayyā āsana puṣpa mūla phalānām pañcagavya pānam
translated: For stealing food, drink, a vehicle, a bed, a seat, flowers, roots, or fruits, one should drink the five products of the cow.

analyzed: tṛṇa kāṣṭha druma śuṣka anna guḍa vastra carma āmiṣāṇām tri rātram upavaset
translated: For stealing grass, wood, trees, dry food, jaggery, cloth, skin, or meat, one should fast for three nights.

analyzed: maṇi muktā pravāla tāmra rajata ayaḥ kāṃsyānām dvādaśa aham kaṇān aśnīyāt
translated: For stealing gems, pearls, coral, copper, silver, iron, or brass, one should eat barley for twelve days.

analyzed: kārpāsa kīṭaja ūrṇā ādi apaharaṇe tri rātram payasā varteta
translated: For stealing cotton, silk, wool, etc., one should subsist on milk for three nights.

analyzed: dviśapha ekaśapha apaharaṇe dvi rātram upavaset
translated: For stealing two-hoofed or one-hoofed animals, one should fast for two nights.

analyzed: pakṣi gandha oṣadhi rajju vaidalānām apaharaṇe dinam upavaset
translated: For stealing birds, perfumes, herbs, ropes, or bamboo, one should fast for one day.

original: yad yat parebhyas tv ādadyāt puruṣas tu niraṅkuśaḥ / tena tena vihīnaḥ syād yatra yatrābhijāyate //
analyzed: yat yat parebhyaḥ tu ādadyāt puruṣaḥ tu niraṅkuśaḥ tena tena vihīnaḥ syāt yatra yatra abhijāyate
translated: Whatever a man takes from others without restraint, by that and that he will be deprived, wherever he is born.

original: jīvitaṃ dharmakāmau ca dhane yasmāt pratiṣṭhitau / tasmāt sarvaprayatnena dhanahiṃsāṃ vivarjayet //
analyzed: jīvitam dharma kāmau ca dhane yasmāt pratiṣṭhitau tasmāt sarva prayatnena dhana hiṃsām vivarjayet
translated: Since life, dharma, and desire are established in wealth, therefore one should avoid injuring wealth with all efforts.

original: prāṇihiṃsāparo yas tu dhanahiṃsāparas tathā / mahad duḥkham avāpnoti dhanahiṃsāparas tayoḥ //
analyzed: prāṇi hiṃsā paraḥ yaḥ tu dhana hiṃsā paraḥ tathā mahat duḥkham avāpnoti dhana hiṃsā paraḥ tayoḥ
translated: One who is devoted to injuring living beings and also to injuring wealth, attains great suffering, of the two, he who is devoted to injuring wealth.

original: athāgamyāgamane mahāvratavidhānenābdaṃ cīravāsā vane prājāpatyaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: atha agamyā gamane mahāvrata vidhānena abdam cīra vāsāḥ vane prājāpatyam kuryāt
translated: Then, for having intercourse with a woman one should not have sexual relations with, one should perform a Prajapatya for one year in the forest, wearing garments of bark, in accordance with the rules of the Mahavratas.

analyzed: para dāra gamane ca
translated: And for having intercourse with another's wife.

analyzed: go vratam go gamane ca
translated: And for having intercourse with a cow, the vow of a cow.

original: puṃsy ayonāv ākāśe 'psu divā goyāne ca savāsāḥ snānam ācaret //
analyzed: puṃsi ayonau ākāśe psu divā goyāne ca sa vāsāḥ snānam ācaret
translated: In the case of a man's organ, in the sky, in water, during the day, and in a cow-cart, one should bathe with one's clothes on.

analyzed: caṇḍālī gamane tad sāmyam āpnuyāt
translated: For having intercourse with an outcaste woman, one would attain equality with her.

analyzed: ajñānataḥ cāndrāyaṇa dvayam kuryāt
translated: And if it is done unknowingly, one should perform two Chandrayana penances.

analyzed: paśu veśyā gamane ca prājāpatyam
translated: And for having intercourse with an animal or a prostitute, one should perform a Prajapatya penance.

original: sakṛd duṣṭā ca strī yat puruṣasya paradāre tadvrataṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: sakṛt duṣṭā ca strī yat puruṣasya para dāre tad vratam kuryāt
translated: And a woman who has been defiled once should perform the same penance as a man who has intercourse with another's wife.

original: yat karoty ekarātreṇa vṛṣalīsevanād dvijaḥ / tad bhaikṣyabhug japan nityaṃ tribhir varṣair vyapohati //
analyzed: yat karoti eka rātreṇa vṛṣalī sevanāt dvijaḥ tat bhaikṣya bhuj japan nityam tribhiḥ varṣaiḥ vyapohati
translated: The twice-born man who has had intercourse with a Vrishali (outcast woman) for one night, shall remove that (sin) by always begging for alms and muttering (the sacred texts) for three years. (XI. 179).

original: yaḥ pāpātmā yena saha saṃyujyate sa tasyaiva prāyaścittaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: yaḥ pāpa ātmā yena saha saṃyujyate sa tasya eva prāyaścittam kuryāt
translated: And the sinful man with whom one associates, he should perform the same penance.

original: mṛtapañcanakhāt kūpād atyantopahatāc codakaṃ pītvā brāhamaṇas trirātram upavaset //
analyzed: mṛta pañcanakhāt kūpāt atyanta upahatāt ca udakam pītvā brāhamaṇaḥ tri rātram upavaset
translated: A Brahmana who drinks water from a well in which a dead five-toed animal is found, or from a well that is greatly polluted, should fast for three nights.

analyzed: dvi aham rājanyaḥ
translated: A Kshatriya for two days.

analyzed: eka aham vaiśyaḥ
translated: A Vaishya for one day.

analyzed: śūdraḥ naktam
translated: A Shudra should fast for the night.

analyzed: sarve ca ante vratasya pañcagavyam pibeyuḥ
translated: And all of them should drink Panchagavya at the end of the vow.

original: pañcagavyaṃ pibec chūdro brāhmaṇas tu surāṃ pibet / ubhau tau narakaṃ yāto mahārauravasaṃjñitam //
analyzed: pañcagavyam pibet śūdraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tu surām pibet  ubhau tau narakam yātaḥ mahāraurava saṃjñitam
translated: A Shudra should drink Panchagavya, and a Brahmana should drink Sura (wine). Both of them go to hell called Maharaurava. (XI. 180).

original: parvānārogyavarjam ṛtāv avagacchan patnīṃ trirātram upavaset //
analyzed: parva anārogya varjam ṛtau avagacchan patnīm tri rātram upavaset
translated: One who has intercourse with his wife during the menstrual period, except on the Parva days, should fast for three nights.

analyzed: kūṭa sākṣī brahmahatyā vratam caret
translated: A perjurer should perform the penance of Brahmana-slaughter.

analyzed: anudaka mūtra purīṣa karaṇe sa cailam snānam mahāvyāhṛti homaḥ ca
translated: If one passes urine or excrement without water, he should bathe along with his clothes, and perform a Homa with the Mahâvyâhritis.

analyzed: sūryābhyudita nirmuktaḥ sa caila snātaḥ sāvitrī aṣṭaśatam āvartayet
translated: If one has had sexual intercourse before sunrise or after sunset, he must bathe along with his clothes, and repeat the Sâvitrî one hundred and eight times.

original: śvasṛgālaviḍvarāhakharavānaravāyasapuṃścalībhir daṣṭaḥ sravantīm āsādya ṣoḍaśa prāṇāyāmān kuryāt //
analyzed: śva sṛgāla viḍvarāha khara vānara vāyasa puṃścalībhiḥ daṣṭaḥ sravantīm āsādya ṣoḍaśa prāṇāyāmān kuryāt
translated: If he is bitten by a bitch, a jackal, a pig, an ass, a monkey, a crow, or a harlot, he must go to a river, and perform sixteen Prânâyâmas.

original: nāstiko nāstikavṛttiḥ kṛtaghnaḥ kūṭavyavahārī brāhmaṇavṛttighnaś caite saṃvatsaraṃ bhaikṣyeṇa varteran //
analyzed: nāstikaḥ nāstika vṛttiḥ kṛtaghnaḥ kūṭa vyavahārī brāhmaṇa vṛtti ghnaḥ ca ete saṃvatsaram bhaikṣyeṇa varteran
translated: An atheist, one who lives like an atheist, an ungrateful person, a cheat, and one who destroys the livelihood of Brahmanas, shall live on alms for one year.

original: parivittiḥ parivettā ca yayā ca parividyate dātā yājakaś ca cāndrāyaṇaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: parivittiḥ parivettā ca yayā ca parividyate dātā yājakaḥ ca cāndrāyaṇam kuryāt
translated: One who marries before his elder brother, the elder brother who marries before his younger brother, the girl who is married before her elder sister, the giver (of the girl in marriage), and the officiating priest (at the marriage), shall perform a Chandrayana penance.

analyzed: prāṇi bhū puṇya soma vikrayī taptakṛcchram  ārdra auṣadhi gandha puṣpa phala mūla carma vetra vidala tuṣa kapāla keśa bhasma asthi gorasa piṇyāka tila taila vikrayī prājāpatyam
translated: One who sells living beings, land, grain, Soma, or salt, shall perform a Tapta Krichchhra penance.🔽One who sells wet herbs, perfumes, flowers, fruits, roots, skins, canes, split bamboos, husks, potsherds, hair, ashes, bones, milk-products, oil-cakes, sesame seeds, or oil, shall perform a Prajapatya penance.

analyzed: ślaiṣma jatu madhūcchiṣṭa śaṅkha śukti trapu sīsa kṛṣṇaloha audumbara khaḍga pātra vikrayī cāndrāyaṇam kuryāt
translated: One who sells phlegm, lac, honey, wax, conch-shells, oysters, tin, lead, black iron, or copper vessels, swords, or Khaḍga-swords, shall perform a Chandrayana penance.

analyzed: rakta vastra raṅga ratna gandha guḍa madhu rasa ūrṇā vikrayī tri rātram upavaset
translated: One who sells red clothes, dyes, gems, perfumes, jaggery, honey, sugar, or wool, should fast for three nights.

analyzed: māṃsa lavaṇa lākṣā kṣīra vikrayī cāndrāyaṇam kuryāt
translated: One who sells meat, salt, lac, or milk, should perform a lunar penance.

analyzed: tam ca bhūyas ca upanayet
translated: And he should be initiated again.

original: uṣṭreṇa khareṇa vā gatvā nagnaḥ snātvā suptvā bhuktvā prāṇāyāmatrayam kuryāt //
analyzed: uṣṭreṇa khareṇa vā gatvā nagnaḥ snātvā suptvā bhuktvā prāṇāyāma trayam kuryāt
translated: Having gone by a camel or an ass, naked, having bathed, having slept, having eaten, he should perform three prāṇāyāmas.

original: japitvā trīṇi sāvitryāḥ sahasrāṇi samāhitaḥ / māsaṃ goṣṭhe payaḥ pītvā mucyate 'satpratigrahāt //
analyzed: japitvā trīṇi sāvitryāḥ sahasrāṇi samāhitaḥ māsam goṣṭhe payaḥ pītvā mucyate sat pratigrahāt
translated: Having muttered three thousand times the Gāyatrī with a concentrated mind, having drunk milk in a cowpen for a month, he is freed from accepting what is improper.

original: ayājyayājanaṃ kṛtvā pareṣām antyakarma ca / abhicāram ahīnaṃ ca tribhiḥ kṛcchrair vyapohati //
analyzed: a yājya yājanam kṛtvā pareṣām antyakarma ca abhicāram ahīnam ca tribhiḥ kṛcchraiḥ vyapohati
translated: Having performed the worship of those who are not worthy of worship, and the funeral rites for others, and having performed sorcery, he removes (the sin) by three expiations.

original: yeṣāṃ dvijānāṃ sāvitrī nānūcyeta yathāvidhi / tāṃś cārayitvā trīn kṛcchrān yathāvidhy upanāyayet //
analyzed: yeṣām dvijānām sāvitrī na anūcyeta yathāvidhi tān cārayitvā trīn kṛcchrān yathāvidhi upanāyayet
translated: Those twice-born ones for whom the Sāvitrī has not been recited according to the rule, having made them perform three expiations, he should initiate them according to the rule.

original: prāyaścittaṃ cikīrṣanti vikarmasthās tu ye dvijāḥ / brāhmaṇyāc ca parityaktās teṣām apy etad ādiśet //
analyzed: prāyaścittam cikīrṣanti vikarma sthāḥ tu ye dvijāḥ brāhmaṇyāt ca parityaktāḥ teṣām api etat ādiśet
translated: And this should be prescribed even for those twice-born ones who desire to perform an expiation, but who are engaged in improper occupations, and who are abandoned by their Brahmanical status.

original: yad garhitenārjayanti karmaṇā brāhmaṇā dhanam / tasyotsargeṇa śudhyanti japyena tapasā tathā //
analyzed: yat garhitena arjayanti karmaṇā brāhmaṇāḥ dhanam tasya utsargeṇa śudhyanti japyena tapasā tathā
translated: If Brahmanas acquire wealth by censurable acts, they become purified by renouncing it, by muttering (sacred texts), and by penance.

original: vedoditānāṃ nityānāṃ karmaṇāṃ samatikrame / snātakavratalope ca prāyaścittam abhojanam //🔽avagūrya caret kṛcchram atikṛcchraṃ nipātane /
analyzed: veda uditānām nityānām karmaṇām samatikrame snātaka vrata lope ca prāyaścittam abhojanam  avagūrya caret kṛcchram atikṛcchram nipātane
translated: In the case of the omission of the obligatory rites enjoined by the Veda, and in the case of the omission of the vows of a Snataka, the penance is fasting.🔽Having offended, one should perform a Krichchhra; for striking, an Atikrichchhra.

analyzed: kṛcchrātikṛcchram kurvīta viprasya utpādya śoṇitam
translated: For causing blood to flow from a Brahmana, one should perform a Krichchhra-Atikrichchhra.

original: enasvibhir nirṇiktair nārthaṃ kiṃcit samācaret / kṛtanirṇejanāṃś caitān na jugupseta dharmavit //
analyzed: enasvibhiḥ nirṇiktaiḥ na artham kiṃcid samācaret kṛta nirṇejanān ca etān na jugupseta dharma vid
translated: One should not have any dealings with sinners who have not been purified, but a man who knows the Law should not despise them when they have been purified.

original: bālaghnāṃś ca kṛtaghnāṃś ca viśuddhān api dharmataḥ / śaraṇāgatahantṝṃś ca strīhantṝṃś ca na saṃvaset //
analyzed: bāla ghnān ca kṛtaghnān ca viśuddhān api dharmataḥ śaraṇa āgata hantṝn ca strī hantṝn ca na saṃvaset
translated: One should not associate with those who have killed a child, those who have killed an ungrateful person, those who have killed a person who has sought their protection, and those who have killed a woman, even if they are purified according to the Law.

original: aśītir yasya varṣāṇi bālo vāpy ūnaṣoḍaśaḥ / prāyaścittārdham arhanti striyo rogiṇa eva ca //
analyzed: aśītiḥ yasya varṣāṇi bālaḥ vā api ūna ṣoḍaśaḥ prāyaścitta ardham arhanti striyaḥ rogiṇaḥ eva ca
translated: One who is less than eighty years old and a boy less than sixteen years old are entitled to half the penance, as also women and sick persons.

analyzed: an ukta niṣkṛtīnām tu pāpānām apanuttaye
translated: But for the expiation of sins for which no atonement has been mentioned,

analyzed: atha rahasya prāyaścittāni bhavanti
translated: Now follow the secret penances.

original: sravantīm āsādya snātaḥ pratyahaṃ ṣoḍaśa prāṇāyāmān salakṣaṇān kṛtvaikakālaṃ haviṣyāśī māsena brahmahā pūto bhavati //
analyzed: sravantīm āsādya snātaḥ pratyaham ṣoḍaśa prāṇāyāmān sa lakṣaṇān kṛtvā ekakālam haviṣya āśī māsena brahma hā pūtaḥ bhavati
translated: Having reached a flowing river, having bathed, having performed sixteen Prāṇāyāmas along with their characteristics, eating once a day food fit for oblations, in a month the killer of a Brahmin becomes purified.

analyzed: karmaṇaḥ nte payasvinīm gām dadyāt
translated: At the end of the rite, he should give a milch cow.

analyzed: vratena aghamarṣaṇena ca surā paḥ pūtaḥ bhavati
translated: By the vow of Aghamarṣaṇa, the drinker of liquor becomes purified.

analyzed: gāyatrī daśa sāhasra japena suvarṇa steya kṛt
translated: By muttering the Gāyatrī ten thousand times, the stealer of gold becomes pure.

analyzed: tri rātra upoṣitaḥ puruṣasūkta japa homābhyām guru talpa gaḥ
translated: Having fasted for three nights, by muttering and offering oblations with the Puruṣa Sūkta, the violator of the Guru's bed becomes pure.

original: yathāśvamedhaḥ kraturāṭ sarvapāpāpanodakaḥ / tathāghamarṣaṇaṃ sūktaṃ sarvapāpāpanodakam //
analyzed: yathā aśvamedhaḥ kratu rāj sarva pāpa apanodakaḥ tathā aghamarṣaṇam sūktam sarva pāpa apanodakam
translated: Just as the horse sacrifice, the king of sacrifices, removes all sins, in the same way the Aghamarṣaṇa hymn removes all sins.

analyzed: prāṇāyāmam dvijaḥ kuryāt sarva pāpa apanuttaye
translated: A twice-born should perform Prāṇāyāma for the removal of all sins.

analyzed: dahyante sarva pāpāni prāṇāyāmaiḥ dvijasya tu
translated: All the sins of a twice-born are burnt by Prāṇāyāmas.

original: savyāhṛtiṃ sapraṇavāṃ gāyatrīṃ śirasā saha / triḥ paṭhed āyataprāṇaḥ prāṇāyāmaḥ sa ucyate //
analyzed: sa vyāhṛtim sa praṇavām gāyatrīm śirasā saha tris paṭhet āyata prāṇaḥ prāṇāyāmaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: One should recite the Gāyatrī with Vyāhṛtis and Praṇava, along with the Śiras, with extended Prāṇa - that is called Prāṇāyāma.

original: akāraṃ cāpy ukāraṃ ca makāraṃ ca prajāpatiḥ / vedatrayān niraduhad bhūr bhuvaḥ svar itīti ca //
analyzed: akāram ca api ukāram ca makāram ca prajāpatiḥ veda trayāt niraduhat bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti iti ca
translated: Prajāpati milked the three Vedas - the letters A, U, and M, and also Bhūḥ, Bhuvaḥ, Svaḥ.

original: tribhya eva tu vedebhyaḥ pādaṃ pādam adūduhat / tad ity ṛco 'syāḥ sāvitryāḥ parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: tribhyaḥ eva tu vedebhyaḥ pādam pādam adūduhat tat iti ṛcaḥ syāḥ sāvitryāḥ parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ
translated: From the three Vedas, he milked out a quarter each. That is the Ṛc of this Sāvitrī, the Supreme Lord Prajāpati.

original: etad akṣaram etāṃ ca japan vyāhṛtipūrvikām / saṃdhyayor vedavid vipro vedapuṇyena yujyate //
analyzed: etat akṣaram etām ca japan vyāhṛti pūrvikām saṃdhyayoḥ veda vid vipraḥ veda puṇyena yujyate
translated: The knower of the Vedas, the Brāhmaṇa, repeating this syllable and this Sāvitrī preceded by the Mahāvyāhṛtis at the two twilights, becomes united with the merit of the Vedas.

original: sahasrakṛtvas tv abhyasya bahir etat trikaṃ dvijaḥ / mahato 'py enaso māsāt tvacevāhir vimucyate //
analyzed: sahasra kṛtvas tu abhyasya bahis etat trikam dvijaḥ mahataḥ pi enasaḥ māsāt tvacā iva ahiḥ vimucyate
translated: The twice-born, repeating this triad a thousand times outside, is freed from even great sin in a month, as a snake from its skin.

analyzed: vipra kṣatriya viś jātiḥ garhaṇām yāti sādhuṣu
translated: The Brāhmaṇa, the Kṣatriya, and the Vaiśya, who are born in the three castes, attain blame in the eyes of the virtuous.

original: oṃkārapūrvikās tisro mahāvyāhṛtayo 'vyayāḥ / tripadā caiva gāyatrī vijñeyā brāhmaṇo mukham //
analyzed: oṃkāra pūrvikāḥ tisraḥ mahāvyāhṛtayaḥ vyayāḥ tripadā ca eva gāyatrī vijñeyā brāhmaṇaḥ mukham
translated: The three imperishable Mahāvyāhṛtis preceded by Oṃkāra, and the Gāyatrī with three feet, should be known as the mouth of the Brāhmaṇa.

original: yo 'dhīte 'hany ahany etāṃ trīṇi varṣāṇy atandritaḥ / sa brahma param abhyeti vāyubhūtaḥ khamūrtimān //
analyzed: yaḥ dhīte hani ahani etām trīṇi varṣāṇi atandritaḥ sa brahma param abhyeti vāyu bhūtaḥ kha mūrtimān
translated: He who daily recites this without laziness for three years, becomes united with the highest Brahman, becoming wind and having the form of the sky.

original: ekākṣaraṃ paraṃ brahma prāṇāyāmāḥ paraṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: ekākṣaram param brahma prāṇāyāmāḥ param tapaḥ
translated: The syllable Om is the highest Brahman, breath-control is the highest austerity.

original: sāvitryās tu paraṃ nānyan maunāt satyaṃ viśiṣyate //
analyzed: sāvitryāḥ tu param na anyat maunāt satyam viśiṣyate
translated: There is nothing higher than the Sāvitrī, truthfulness excels silence.

analyzed: kṣaranti sarvāḥ vaidikyaḥ juhoti yajati kriyāḥ
translated: All the Vedic rites of offering oblations and worshipping decay.

original: akṣaraṃ tv akṣaraṃ jñeyaṃ brahmā caiva prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: akṣaram tu akṣaram jñeyam brahmā ca eva prajāpatiḥ
translated: The imperishable should be known as the imperishable, and also Brahman and Prajapati.

analyzed: vidhiyajñāt japayajñaḥ viśiṣṭaḥ daśabhiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: The muttering sacrifice is superior to the sacrifice enjoined by rules by ten qualities.

original: upāṃśuḥ syāc chataguṇaḥ sahasro mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ //
analyzed: upāṃśuḥ syāt śataguṇaḥ sahasraḥ mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The inaudible one should be a hundred times better, and the mental one is said to be a thousand times better.

original: ye pākayajñāś catvāro vidhiyajñasamanvitāḥ / te sarve japayajñasya kalāṃ nārhanti ṣoḍaśīm //
analyzed: ye pākayajñāḥ catvāraḥ vidhi yajña samanvitāḥ te sarve japa yajñasya kalām na arhanti ṣoḍaśīm
translated: All those four cooked sacrifices along with the sacrifice enjoined by rules, do not deserve even a sixteenth part of the sacrifice of muttering.

original: japyenaiva tu saṃsidhyed brāhmaṇo nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: japyena eva tu saṃsidhyet brāhmaṇaḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: A Brahmin would certainly be perfected by mere muttering.

original: kuryād anyan na vā kuryān maitro brāhmaṇa ucyate //
analyzed: kuryāt anyat na vā kuryāt maitraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ucyate
translated: He may do something else or not do, he is said to be a friendly Brahmin.

analyzed: atha atha sarva veda pavitrāṇi bhavanti
translated: Now, the Atharva Veda, all the purifying rites of the Vedas,

original: yeṣāṃ japyaiś ca homaiś ca dvijātayaḥ pāpebhyaḥ pūyante //
analyzed: yeṣām japyaiḥ ca homaiḥ ca dvijātayaḥ pāpebhyaḥ pūyante
translated: By the muttering and oblations of which the twice-born are purified from sins.

analyzed: aghamarṣaṇam
translated: The Aghamarṣaṇa [hymn].

analyzed: deva kṛtam
translated: The Devakṛta [hymn].

analyzed: śuddhavatyaḥ
translated: The Śuddhavatīs [hymns].

analyzed: taratsamandīyam
translated: The Taratsamandīya [hymn].

analyzed: kūśmāṇḍyaḥ
translated: The Kūṣmāṇḍīs [hymns].

analyzed: pāvamānyaḥ
translated: The Pāvamānī [hymns].

analyzed: durgāsāvitrī
translated: The Durgāsāvitrī [hymn].

analyzed: atīṣaṅgāḥ
translated: The Atīṣaṅgas [hymns].

analyzed: pada stomāḥ
translated: The Pada-stomas [hymns].

analyzed: samāni vyāhṛtayaḥ
translated: The Vyāhṛtis [words].

analyzed: bhāruṇḍāṇi
translated: The Bhāruṇḍas [hymns].

analyzed: candra sāma
translated: The Candra-sāman [hymn].

analyzed: puruṣavrate sāmanī
translated: The Puruṣa-vrata Sāman hymns.

analyzed: abliṅgam
translated: The Ablin [hymn].

analyzed: bārhaspatyam  gosūktam
translated: The Bārhaspatya [hymn].🔽The Gosaṃhitā [hymn].

analyzed: aśvasūktam
translated: The Aśvasaṃhitā [hymn].

analyzed: sāmanī candrasūkte ca
translated: And the two Sāman hymns, the Chandrā hymn,

analyzed: śatarudriyam
translated: The Śatarudriya,

analyzed: atharvaśiraḥ
translated: The Atharvaśiras,

analyzed: tri suparṇam
translated: The Trisuparṇa,

analyzed: mahāvratam
translated: The Mahāvrata,

analyzed: nārāyaṇīyam
translated: The Nārāyaṇīya,

analyzed: puruṣasūktam ca
translated: And the Puruṣa Sūkta.

original: trīṇy ājyadohāni rathantaraṃ ca agnivrataṃ vāmadevyaṃ bṛhac ca / etāni gītāni punāti jantūn jātismaratvaṃ labhate yadīcchet //
analyzed: trīṇi ājyadohāni rathantaram ca agnivratam vāmadevyam bṛhat ca  etāni gītāni punāti jantūn jātismara tvam labhate yadi icchet
translated: These hymns purify beings, and if one wishes, one attains the ability to remember one's past lives.

analyzed: atha tyājyāḥ  vrātyāḥ
translated: Now, those to be avoided:🔽Outcasts,

analyzed: patitāḥ
translated: Fallen,

analyzed: tri puruṣam mātṛtaḥ pitṛtaḥ ca aśuddhāḥ
translated: And those impure for three generations on the mother's and father's sides.

analyzed: sarve eva a bhojyāḥ ca a pratigrāhyāḥ
translated: All of them are unfit to be eaten and to receive gifts.

analyzed: a pratigrāhyebhyaḥ ca pratigraha prasaṅgam varjayet
translated: One should avoid the occasion of receiving gifts from those who are unfit to receive gifts.

analyzed: pratigraheṇa brāhmaṇānām brāhmam tejaḥ praṇaśyati
translated: By receiving gifts, the brahmic splendor of the Brahmins is destroyed.

original: dravyāṇāṃ vāvijñāya pratigrahavidhiṃ yaḥ pratigrahaṃ kuryāt sa dātrā saha nimajjati //
analyzed: dravyāṇām vā a vijñāya pratigraha vidhim yaḥ pratigraham kuryāt sa dātrā saha nimajjati
translated: One who receives gifts without knowing the rules of receiving gifts, sinks along with the giver.

original: pratigrahasamarthaś ca yaḥ pratigrahaṃ varjayet sa dātṛlokam avāpnoti //
analyzed: pratigraha samarthaḥ ca yaḥ pratigraham varjayet sa dātṛ lokam avāpnoti
translated: One who is capable of receiving gifts but avoids receiving gifts, attains the world of the giver.

analyzed: edha udaka mūla phala abhaya āmiṣa madhu śayyā āsana gṛha puṣpa dadhi śākan ca abhyudyatān na nirṇudet
translated: One should not reject fuel, water, roots, fruits, vegetables, meat, honey, bedding, seats, houses, flowers, curd, and vegetables that are offered.

original: āhūyābhyudyatāṃ bhikṣāṃ purastād anucoditām / grāhyāṃ prajāpatir mene api duṣkṛtakarmaṇaḥ //
analyzed: āhūya abhyudyatām bhikṣām purastāt anucoditām  grāhyām prajāpatiḥ mene api duṣkṛta karmaṇaḥ
translated: If a man is called upon to receive alms that are offered to him, he may accept them, even if he be a sinner, for Prajapati has ordained that they may be accepted.

original: nāśnanti pitaras tasya daśa varṣāṇi pañca ca / na ca havyaṃ vahaty agnir yas tām abhyavamanyate //
analyzed: na aśnanti pitaraḥ tasya daśa varṣāṇi pañca ca  na ca havyam vahati agniḥ yaḥ tām abhyavamanyate
translated: For ten years and five, his manes do not eat his offerings, nor does the fire convey his oblations, who disdains the alms that are offered to him.

analyzed: gurūn bhṛtyān ujjihīrṣuḥ arciṣyan pitṛ devatāḥ
translated: He who wishes to support his superiors and dependents, and to worship the manes and the gods,

original: sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇīyān na tu tṛpyet svayaṃ tataḥ //
analyzed: sarvatas pratigṛhṇīyāt na tu tṛpyet svayam tatas
translated: may accept gifts from all, but he must not satisfy his own desires with them.🔽Even though he be able to accept gifts for the purposes above mentioned, he must not take them from a public woman, a eunuch, an outcast, an enemy, or a man who has killed a learned Brahmana.

original: eteṣv api ca kāryeṣu samarthas tatpratigrahe / nādadyāt kulaṭāṣaṇḍha patitebhyas tathā dviṣaḥ // guruṣu tv abhyatīteṣu vinā vā tair gṛhe vasan /
analyzed: eteṣu api ca kāryeṣu samarthaḥ tad pratigrahe  na ādadyāt kulaṭā ṣaṇḍha patitebhyaḥ tathā dviṣaḥ guruṣu tu abhyatīteṣu vinā vā taiḥ gṛhe vasan
translated: If his superiors have died, or if he lives alone in the house,

original: ardhikaḥ kulamitraṃ ca dāsagopālanāpitāḥ / ete śūdreṣu bhojyānnā yaś cātmānaṃ nivedayet //
analyzed: ardhikaḥ kula mitram ca dāsa gopāla nāpitāḥ ete śūdreṣu bhojya annāḥ yaḥ ca ātmānam nivedayet
translated: a money-lender, a friend of the family, a servant, a cowherd, a nurse, these may be fed on food fit for a Sudra, as also he who offers himself.

analyzed: atha gṛhāśramiṇaḥ trividhaḥ rthaḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the householder has three kinds of wealth:

original: śuklaḥ śabalo 'sitaś ca //🔽śuklenārthena yadaurdhvadehikaṃ karoti tenāsya devatvam āsādayati //
analyzed: śuklaḥ śabalaḥ sitaḥ ca  śuklena arthena yat aurdhvadehikam karoti tena asya deva tvam āsādayati
translated: white, variegated, and black.🔽By means of his white wealth he attains the state of a god.

analyzed: yat śabalena tat mānuṣyam
translated: By means of his variegated wealth he attains the state of a human being.

analyzed: yat kṛṣṇena tat tiryaktvam
translated: What is done by Kṛṣṇa is animal-like.

analyzed: sva vṛtti upārjitam sarveṣām śuklam
translated: All that is earned by one's own occupation is white for all.

analyzed: eka antarita vṛtti upāttam ca kṛṣṇam
translated: And that obtained through occupation interrupted by another is black.

original: kramāgataṃ prītidāyaṃ prāptaṃ ca saha bhāryayā / aviśeṣeṇa sarveṣāṃ dhanaṃ śuklam udāhṛtam //
analyzed: krama āgatam prīti dāyam prāptam ca saha bhāryayā aviśeṣeṇa sarveṣām dhanam śuklam udāhṛtam
translated: What is inherited, what is given out of affection, and what is obtained along with one's wife, without distinction, is declared to be white wealth for all.

original: kṛtopakārād āptaṃ ca śabalaṃ samudāhṛtam // pārśvikadyūtacauryāpta pratirūpakasāhasaiḥ / vyājenopārjitaṃ yac ca tat kṛṣṇaṃ samudāhṛtam //
analyzed: kṛta upakārāt āptam ca śabalam samudāhṛtam pārśvika dyūta caurya āpta pratirūpaka sāhasaiḥ vyājena upārjitam yat ca tat kṛṣṇam samudāhṛtam
translated: And what is obtained from one who has been obliged is declared to be mixed. And what is obtained by usury, gambling, theft, by acting as a surety, and by violence, and what is earned by fraud, that is declared to be black.

original: yathāvidhena dravyeṇa yat kiṃcit kurute naraḥ / tathāvidham avāpnoti sa phalaṃ pretya ceha ca //
analyzed: yathāvidhena dravyeṇa yat kiṃcid kurute naraḥ tathāvidham avāpnoti sa phalam pretya ca iha ca
translated: Whatever a man does with whatever kind of wealth, he obtains a corresponding fruit in this world and the next.

analyzed: gṛha āśramī vaivāhika agnau pākayajñān kuryāt
translated: A householder should perform the Pañcayajñas in the marriage fire.

analyzed: sāyam prātar ca agnihotram
translated: He should perform the Agnihotra in the evening and morning.

analyzed: devatābhyaḥ juhuyāt devātābhyaḥ
translated: He should offer oblations to the deities.

analyzed: candra arka saṃnikarṣa viprakarṣayoḥ darśa pūrṇamāsābhyām yajeta
translated: He should perform the Darśa and Paurnamāsa sacrifices when the moon is near and far from the sun.

analyzed: śarad grīṣmayoḥ ca āgrayaṇena
translated: And the Āgrayaṇa sacrifice in autumn and summer.

analyzed: vrīhi yavayoḥ vā pāke
translated: Or when the rice and barley are ripe.

analyzed: traivārṣika abhyadhikāt naḥ 🔽pratyabdam somena
translated: Not more than three years old.🔽Every year with Soma.

analyzed: vitta abhāve iṣṭyā vaiśvānaryā
translated: In the absence of wealth, by the Iṣṭi of Vaiśvānara.

original: yajñārthaṃ bhikṣitam avāptam arthaṃ sakalam eva vitaret //
analyzed: yajña artham bhikṣitam avāptam artham sakalam eva vitaret
translated: He should distribute the entire wealth obtained by begging for the purpose of sacrifice.

analyzed: sāyam prātar vaiśvadevam juhuyāt
translated: He should offer the Vaiśvadeva oblation in the evening and morning.

analyzed: bhikṣām ca bhikṣave dadyāt
translated: And he should give alms to a beggar.

analyzed: arcita bhikṣā dānena go dāna phalam āpnoti
translated: By giving worshipped alms, he obtains the fruit of giving a cow.

analyzed: bhikṣu abhāve grāsa mātram gavām dadyāt
translated: In the absence of a beggar, he should give just a morsel to cows.

analyzed: vahnau vā prakṣipet
translated: Or he should throw it into the fire.

original: bhukte 'py anne vidyamāne na bhikṣukaṃ pratyācakṣīta //
analyzed: bhukte pi anne vidyamāne na bhikṣukam pratyācakṣīta
translated: Even if food is available, he should not refuse a mendicant.

original: kaṇḍanī peṣaṇī cullī udakumbha upaskara iti pañca sūnā gṛhasthasya //
analyzed: kaṇḍanī peṣaṇī cullī uda kumbha upaskaraḥ iti pañca sūnāḥ gṛhasthasya
translated: The five butchers for a householder are the pestle, the grinding stone, the stove, the water pot, and the broom.

analyzed: tad niṣkṛti artham ca brahma deva bhūta pitṛ nara yajñān kuryāt
translated: And for the sake of expiating those, he should perform the sacrifices to Brahman, the gods, the ancestors, and men.

analyzed: svādhyāyaḥ brahmayajñaḥ
translated: Reciting the Veda is the sacrifice to Brahman.

analyzed: homaḥ daivaḥ
translated: The oblation is to the gods.

analyzed: pitṛ tarpaṇam pitryaḥ
translated: The offering of water to the ancestors is to the ancestors.

analyzed: baliḥ bhautaḥ
translated: The Bali offering is to the spirits.

analyzed: nṛyajñaḥ ca atithi pūjanam
translated: And the worship of guests is the sacrifice to men.

original: devatātithibhṛtyānāṃ pitṝṇām ātmanaś ca yaḥ / na nirvapati pañcānām ucchvasan na sa jīvati //
analyzed: devatā atithi bhṛtyānām pitṝṇām ātmanaḥ ca yaḥ na nirvapati pañcānām ucchvasan na sa jīvati
translated: He who does not offer to the five - the gods, guests, servants, ancestors, and himself - is not alive, though breathing.

original: brahmacārī yatir bhikṣur jīvanty ete gṛhāśramāt /
analyzed: brahmacārī yatiḥ bhikṣuḥ jīvanti ete gṛha āśramāt
translated: The celibate, the ascetic, and the mendicant live from the householder stage.

original: tasmād abhyāgatān etān gṛhastho nāvamānayet //🔽gṛhastha eva yajate gṛhasthas tapyate tapaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt abhyāgatān etān gṛhasthaḥ na avamānayet  gṛhasthaḥ eva yajate gṛhasthaḥ tapyate tapaḥ
translated: Therefore, a householder should not disrespect these who have come.🔽Only a householder performs sacrifices, a householder practices austerities,

original: pradadāti gṛhasthaś ca tasmāc chreṣṭho gṛhāśramī //
analyzed: pradadāti gṛhasthaḥ ca tasmāt śreṣṭhaḥ gṛhāśramī
translated: and a householder gives gifts. Therefore, the householder is the best.

original: ṛṣayaḥ pitaro devā bhūtāny atithayas tathā /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ bhūtāni atithayaḥ tathā
translated: The sages, ancestors, gods, beings, and guests

analyzed: āśāsate kuḍumbibhyaḥ tasmāt śreṣṭhaḥ gṛhāśramī
translated: hope for these from householders. Therefore, the householder is the best.🔽By serving the three goals, always giving food, worshipping gods, honouring Brahmins,

original: trivargasevāṃ satatānnadānaṃ surārcanaṃ brāhmaṇapūjanaṃ ca / svādhyāyasevāṃ pitṛtarpaṇaṃ ca kṛtvā gṛhī śakrapadaṃ prayāti //
analyzed: trivarga sevām satata anna dānam sura arcanam brāhmaṇa pūjanam ca svādhyāya sevām pitṛ tarpaṇam ca kṛtvā gṛhī śakra padam prayāti
translated: studying, and offering libations to ancestors, a householder attains the state of Indra.

analyzed: brāhme muhūrte utthāya mūtra purīṣa utsargam kuryāt
translated: One should get up during Brahma muhurta and then pass urine and excreta.

original: dakṣiṇābhimukho rātrau divā codaṅmukhaḥ saṃdhyayoś ca //🔽nāpracchāditāyāṃ bhūmau //🔽na phālakṛṣṭāyām //
analyzed: dakṣiṇa abhimukhaḥ rātrau divā ca udak mukhaḥ saṃdhyayoḥ ca  na a pracchāditāyām bhūmau  na phālakṛṣṭāyām
translated: At night one should face south and during the day one should face north, and during the two twilights also.🔽Not on uncovered ground.

analyzed: na chāyāyām  na ca ūṣare  na śādvale
translated: Not on ploughed land.🔽Not in the shade.🔽Not on barren land.

analyzed: na sa sattve  na garte
translated: Not on grassy land.🔽Not on living beings.🔽Not in a pit.

analyzed: na valmīke  na pathi
translated: Not on an anthill.🔽Not on a path.

analyzed: na rathyāyām
translated: Not on a street.

analyzed: na parā aśucau  na udyāne  na bhasmani na aṅgāre  na gomaye
translated: Not on impure ground.🔽Not in a garden.🔽Not on ashes, not on charcoal.

analyzed: na go vraje
translated: Not on cow dung.🔽Not in a cow pen.

analyzed: na ākāśe
translated: Not in the sky.

analyzed: na udake
translated: Not in water.

analyzed: na prati anila anala indu arka strī guru brāhmaṇānām
translated: Not against the wind, fire, moon, sun, women, preceptors, or Brahmins.

analyzed: na eva an avaguṇṭhita śirāḥ
translated: Not with the head uncovered.

original: loṣṭeṣṭakāparimṛṣṭagudo gṛhītaśiśnaś cotthāyādbhir mṛdbhiś coddhṛtābhir gandhalepakṣayakaraṃ śaucaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: loṣṭa iṣṭakā parimṛṣṭa gudaḥ gṛhīta śiśnaḥ ca utthāya adbhiḥ mṛdbhiḥ ca uddhṛtābhiḥ gandha lepa kṣaya karam śaucam kuryāt
translated: Having wiped the anus with clods of earth and potsherds, and having risen, having taken hold of the penis, he should perform the purification that removes smell and dirt with water and earth that have been taken.

original: ekā liṅge gude tisras tathaikatra kare daśa / ubhayoḥ sapta dātavyā mṛdas tisras tu pādayoḥ //
analyzed: ekā liṅge gude tisraḥ tathā ekatra kare daśa ubhayoḥ sapta dātavyāḥ mṛdaḥ tisraḥ tu pādayoḥ
translated: One in the penis, three in the anus, and ten on one hand, seven should be applied to both, and three clods on the feet.

analyzed: etat śaucam gṛhasthānām dviguṇam brahmacāriṇām
translated: This purification is for householders, double for celibate students,

original: triguṇaṃ tu vanasthānāṃ yatīnāṃ tu caturguṇam //
analyzed: triguṇam tu vanasthānām yatīnām tu caturguṇam
translated: triple for forest dwellers, and quadruple for ascetics.

analyzed: atha pālāśam dantadhāvanam na adyāt
translated: Now, one should not chew a tooth-stick made of Palasha wood.

analyzed: na eva śleṣmātaka ariṣṭa vibhītaka dhava dhanvana jam  na ca bandhūka nirguṇḍī śigru tilva tinduka jam
translated: Nor of Shleshmataka, Arishta, Vibhitaka, Dhava, or Dhanvana.🔽Nor of Bandhuka, Nirguṇḍī, Śigru, Tīlva, or Tinduka.

analyzed: na ca kovidāra śamī pīlu pippala iṅguda guggulu jam
translated: Nor of Kovidāra, Śamī, Pīlu, Pippala, Iṅguda, or Guggulu.

analyzed: na pāribhadraka amlikā mocaka śālmalī śaṇa jam  na madhuram
translated: Nor of Pāribhadraka, Āmlika, Mūlaka, Śalmali, or Śaṇa.🔽Not sweet.

analyzed: na amlam  na ūrdhva śuṣkam  na suṣiram
translated: Not sour.🔽Not dry from above.🔽Not hollow.

analyzed: na pūti gandhi
translated: Not foul-smelling.

analyzed: na picchilam
translated: Not slimy.

analyzed: na dakṣiṇa apara abhimukhaḥ
translated: Not facing south or west.

analyzed: adyāt ca udak mukhaḥ prāc mukhaḥ vā
translated: He should eat facing north or east.

analyzed: vaṭa asana arka khadira karañja badara sarja nimba arimeda apāmārga mālatī kakubha bilvānām anyatamam
translated: Of the wood of a banyan tree, arka plant, khadira tree, karñja tree, jujube tree, sarja tree, neem tree, arimeda plant, apāmārga plant, mālatī creeper, kakubha tree, or bilva tree.

analyzed: kaṣāyam tiktam kaṭukam ca
translated: Astringent, bitter, or pungent.

original: kanīnyagrasamasthaulyaṃ sakūrcaṃ dvādaśāṅgulam / prātarbhūtvā ca yatavāg bhakṣayed dantadhāvanam //
analyzed: kanīnī agra sama sthaulyam sa kūrcam dvādaśa aṅgulam prātar bhūtvā ca yata vāc bhakṣayet dantadhāvanam
translated: The size of the tip of the thumb, with a brush, twelve fingers long. Having become pure in the morning, with controlled speech, one should chew the tooth-stick.

original: prakṣālya bhaṅktvā taj jahyāc chucau deśe prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: prakṣālya bhaṅktvā tat jahyāt śucau deśe prayatnataḥ
translated: Having washed it and broken it, one should carefully discard it in a clean place.

analyzed: amāvāsyām na ca aśnīyāt dantakāṣṭham kadācana
translated: One should never chew a tooth-stick on the new moon day.

original: atha dvijātīnāṃ kanīnikāmūle prājāpatyaṃ nāma tīrtham //
analyzed: atha dvijātīnām kanīnikā mūle prājāpatyam nāma tīrtham
translated: Now, at the base of the pupil of the eye of the twice-born, there is a sacred place called Prājāpatya.

analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mūle brāhmam
translated: At the base of the thumb, it is Brāhma.

analyzed: aṅguli agre daivam
translated: At the tip of the finger, it is Daiva.

original: tarjanīmūle pitryam //🔽anagnyuṣṇābhir aphenilābhiḥ aśūdraikakarāvarjitābhir akṣārābhir adbhiḥ śucau deśe svāsīno 'ntarjānu prāṅmukhaś codaṅmukho vā tanmanāḥ sumanāś
analyzed: tarjanī mūle pitryam  an agni uṣṇābhiḥ a phenilābhiḥ a śūdra eka kara āvarjitābhiḥ akṣārābhiḥ adbhiḥ śucau deśe su āsīnaḥ ntarjānu prāc mukhaḥ ca udak mukhaḥ vā tanmanāḥ sumanāḥ
translated: At the base of the index finger, it is Pitrya.🔽In a clean place, seated with the knees drawn up to the chest, facing east or north, with a focused mind, a cheerful mind,

analyzed: ca ācāmet brāhmeṇa tīrthena tris ācāmet
translated: one should sip water that is not from a fire, not hot, not frothy, not collected with a Śūdra's hand, not salty, with the sacred place called Brāhma, one should sip water three times.

analyzed: dvis pramṛjyāt
translated: One should wipe twice.

original: khāny adbhir mūrdhānaṃ hṛdayaṃ spṛśet //🔽hṛtkaṇṭhatālugābhiś ca yathāsaṃkhyaṃ dvijātayaḥ /
analyzed: khāni adbhiḥ mūrdhānam hṛdayam spṛśet  hṛd kaṇṭha tālu gābhiḥ ca yathāsaṃkhyam dvijātayaḥ
translated: He should touch the head and the heart with water.🔽The twice-born should be purified, respectively, by touching the heart, throat, and palate,

original: śudhyeran strī ca śūdraś ca sakṛt spṛṣṭābhir antataḥ //
analyzed: śudhyeran strī ca śūdraḥ ca sakṛt spṛṣṭābhiḥ antatas
translated: and a woman and a Shudra by touching once.

analyzed: atha yogakṣema artham īśvaram abhigacchet  na ekaḥ dhvānam prapadyeta
translated: Then, for the sake of prosperity, he should approach the lord.🔽One should not undertake a journey alone.

analyzed: na adhārmikaiḥ sārdham  na vṛṣalaiḥ
translated: Not with the unrighteous.🔽Not with Shudras.

analyzed: na dviṣadbhiḥ na ati pratyūṣasi
translated: Not with enemies. Not too early in the morning.

analyzed: na ati sāyam  na saṃdhyayoḥ
translated: Not too late in the evening.🔽Not during twilight.

analyzed: na madhyāhne  na saṃnihita pānīyam
translated: Not at midday.🔽Not where water is nearby.

analyzed: na ati tūrṇam
translated: Not too quickly.

analyzed: na satatam bāla vyādhita ārtaiḥ vāhanaiḥ
translated: Not always with vehicles that are young, sick, or distressed.

analyzed: na hīna aṅgaiḥ  na dīnaiḥ
translated: Not with those deficient in limbs.🔽Not with the poor.

analyzed: na gobhiḥ
translated: Not with cows.

analyzed: na a da antaiḥ
translated: Not with the untrained.

original: yavasodake vāhanānām adattvā ātmanaḥ kṣuttṛṣṇāpanodanaṃ na kuryāt //
analyzed: yavasa udake vāhanānām a dattvā ātmanaḥ kṣudh tṛṣṇā apanodanam na kuryāt
translated: Without giving fodder and water to the animals, one should not relieve one's own hunger and thirst.

analyzed: na catuṣpatham adhitiṣṭhet
translated: One should not stand at a crossroads.

analyzed: na rātrau vṛkṣa mūle
translated: Not under a tree at night.

analyzed: na śūnya ālayam
translated: Not in an empty house.

analyzed: na tṛṇam
translated: Not on grass.

analyzed: na paśūnām bandhanāgāram
translated: Not in the stable of animals.

analyzed: na keśa tuṣa kapāla asthi bhasma aṅgārān
translated: Not on hair, chaff, potsherds, bones, ashes, or charcoal.

analyzed: na kārpāsa asthi
translated: Not on cotton seeds.

analyzed: catuṣpatham prakakṣiṇīkuryāt
translated: One should circumambulate a crossroad,

analyzed: devatā arcām ca
translated: and also a temple,

analyzed: prajñātān ca vanasptīn  agni brāhmaṇa gaṇikā pūrṇa kumbha ādarśa chatra dhvaja patākā śrīvṛkṣa vardhamāna nandyāvartān ca
translated: and also well-known trees,🔽and also fire, Brahmins, a group of women, a full pot, a mirror, an umbrella, a banner, a flag, a prosperous tree, a growing tree, and a clockwise-growing plant,

analyzed: tālavṛnta cāmara aśva gaja aja go dadhi kṣīra madhu siddhārthakān ca
translated: and also a palm-leaf fan, a yak-tail whisk, a horse, an elephant, a cow, curd, milk, honey, and white mustard seeds,

analyzed: vīṇā candana āyudha ārdra gomaya phala puṣpa ārdra śāka gorocanā dūrvā prarohān ca
translated: and also a lute, sandalwood, weapons, wet cow dung, fruits, flowers, wet vegetables, red arsenic, and sprouting Dūrvā grass,

analyzed: uṣṇīṣa alaṃkāra maṇi kanaka rajata vastra āsana yāna āmiṣān ca
translated: and also a turban, ornaments, jewels, gold, silver, clothes, seats, vehicles, and food.

analyzed: atha matta unmatta vyaṅgān dṛṣṭvā nivarteta  vānta virikta muṇḍa jaṭila vāmanān ca
translated: Then, if one sees an intoxicated, insane, or deformed person, one should turn back.

analyzed: kāṣāyi pravrajita malinān ca  taila guḍa śuṣka gomaya indhana tṛṇa palāśa bhasma aṅgārān ca  lavaṇa klība āsava napuṃsaka kārpāsa rajju nigaḍa mukta keśān ca
translated: And also one who has vomited, had a purgation, is shaven-headed, has matted hair, or is a dwarf,🔽and also one wearing a reddish garment, a renunciant, or a dirty person,🔽and also oil, jaggery, dry cow dung, fuel, grass, leaves, ashes, and charcoal,🔽and also salt, a eunuch, liquor, a neuter, cotton, a rope, a fetter, and one with loose hair,

analyzed: vīnā candana ārdra śāka uṣṇīṣa alaṃkaraṇa kumārīḥ tu prasthāna kāle abhinandayet iti
translated: but one should welcome a lute, sandalwood, wet vegetables, turban, ornaments, and a virgin at the time of departure.

analyzed: deva brāhmaṇa guru babhru dīkṣitānām chāyām na ākrāmet
translated: He should not step on the shadow of gods, Brahmins, elders, or those initiated for a sacrifice.

analyzed: niṣṭhyūta vānta rudhira viṣ mūtra snāna udakāni ca
translated: He should not step on spit, vomit, blood, feces, urine, or bathing water.

original: na vatsatantrīṃ laṅghayet //🔽pravarṣati na dhāvet // na vṛthā nadīṃ taret //
analyzed: na vatsa tantrīm laṅghayet  pravarṣati na dhāvet na vṛthā nadīm taret
translated: He should not jump over a rope to which a calf is tied.🔽He should not run when it is raining. He should not cross a river unnecessarily.

original: na devatābhyaḥ pitṛbhyaś codakam apradāya //🔽na bāhubhyām //
analyzed: na devatābhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ ca udakam a pradāya  na bāhubhyām
translated: He should not cross a river without offering water to gods and ancestors.🔽He should not cross with his arms.

analyzed: na bhinnayā nāvā  na kūlam adhitiṣṭhet
translated: He should not cross in a broken boat.🔽He should not stand on the bank.

analyzed: na kūpam avalokayet
translated: He should not look into a well.

analyzed: na laṅghayet
translated: He should not jump over it.

original: vṛddhabhārinṛpasnāta strīrogivaracakriṇām / panthā deyā nṛpas tv eṣāṃ mānyaḥ snātaś ca bhūpateḥ //
analyzed: vṛddha bhāri nṛpa snāta strī rogi vara cakriṇām panthāḥ deyāḥ nṛpaḥ tu eṣām mānyaḥ snātaḥ ca bhūpateḥ
translated: The path should be given to the elderly, the burdened, the king, the bathed, women, the sick, the bride and groom, and the wheel-turning emperor. The king is to be honored, and the bathed is to be honored by the king.

analyzed: para nipāneṣu na snānam ācaret
translated: He should not bathe in the water-reservoirs of others.

original: ācaret pañca piṇḍān uddhṛtyāpas tad āpadi //🔽nājīrṇe //
analyzed: ācaret pañca piṇḍān uddhṛtya apaḥ tat āpadi  na a jīrṇe
translated: In an emergency, he should take five handfuls of water and offer it to the ancestors.🔽Not when he has indigestion.

analyzed: na nagnaḥ  na rātrau
translated: Not naked.🔽Not at night.

analyzed: na saṃdhyayoḥ
translated: Not at dawn or dusk.

original: prātaḥsnānaśīlo 'ruṇatāmrāṃ prācīm ālokya snāyāt //🔽snātaḥ śiro nāvadhunet //🔽nāṅgebhyas toyam uddharet //
analyzed: prātaḥsnāna śīlaḥ ruṇa tāmrām prācīm ālokya snāyāt  snātaḥ śiraḥ na avadhunet  na aṅgebhyaḥ toyam uddharet
translated: One who is in the habit of bathing in the morning should bathe after seeing the eastern direction tinged with the color of the rising sun.🔽After bathing, he should not shake his head.🔽He should not take water from his limbs.

analyzed: na taila vat saṃspṛśet
translated: He should not touch it like oil.

analyzed: na a prakṣālitam pūrva dhṛtam vasanam bibhṛyāt
translated: He should not wear a garment that has been worn before without washing it.

original: snāta eva soṣṇīṣe dhaute vāsasī bibhṛyāt //
analyzed: snātaḥ eva sa uṣṇīṣe dhaute vāsasī bibhṛyāt
translated: Having bathed, he should wear a washed upper garment and lower garment, with the upper garment on his head.

original: na mlecchāntyajapatitaiḥ saha saṃbhāṣaṇaṃ kuryāt //🔽snāyāt prasravaṇadevakhātasarovareṣu //
analyzed: na mleccha antyaja patitaiḥ saha saṃbhāṣaṇam kuryāt  snāyāt prasravaṇa devakhāta sarovareṣu
translated: He should not converse with barbarians, outcasts, or fallen people.🔽He should bathe in springs, natural ponds, and lakes.

analyzed: uddhṛtāt bhūmiṣṭham udakam puṇyam
translated: Water drawn from the ground is more meritorious than that on the ground.

analyzed: sarvatas eva gāṅgam
translated: Water from the Ganges is meritorious everywhere.

original: mṛttoyaiḥ kṛtamalāpakaṛṣo 'psu nimajjyopaviśyāpo hi ṣṭheti tisṛbhir hiraṇyavarṇeti catasṛbhir idam āpaḥ pravahateti ca tīrtham abhimantrayet
analyzed: mṛd toyaiḥ kṛta mala apakaṛṣaḥ upsu nimajjya upaviśya apaḥ hi stha iti tisṛbhiḥ hiraṇya varṇā iti catasṛbhiḥ idam āpaḥ pravahata iti ca tīrtham abhimantrayet
translated: Having removed dirt and impurities with clay and water, having immersed himself in the water, having sat down, he should consecrate the sacred place with the three verses beginning with Apo hi ṣṭhā, the four beginning with Hiranyagarbhā, and the one beginning with Idam āpaḥ pravaha.

analyzed: tatas u psu nimagnaḥ tris aghamarṣaṇam japet
translated: Then, having immersed himself in the water, he should murmur the Aghamarṣaṇa hymn three times.

analyzed: tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam iti vā
translated: Or the verse beginning with Tad viṣṇoḥ paramam padaṃ.

analyzed: drupadām sāvitrīm ca
translated: And the Drupadā and Sāvitrī verses.

analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ iti anuvākam vā
translated: Or the Anuvāka beginning with Yunajte manaḥ.

analyzed: puruṣasūktam vā
translated: Or the Puruṣa Sūkta.

original: snātaś cārdravāsā devapitṛtarpaṇam ambhaḥstha eva kuryāt //
analyzed: snātaḥ ca ārdra vāsāḥ deva pitṛ tarpaṇam ambhaḥ sthaḥ eva kuryāt
translated: Having bathed, he should perform the water libations to the gods and ancestors while still in the water, wearing wet garments.

analyzed: parivartita vāsāḥ ced tīrtham uttīrya
translated: If he has changed his garments, then after coming out of the sacred place.

analyzed: a kṛtvā deva pitṛ tarpaṇam snāna śāṭīm na pīḍayet
translated: Without having performed the water libations to the gods and ancestors, he should not wring out the bathing garment.

analyzed: snātvā ācamya vidhivat upaspṛśet
translated: Having bathed and sipped water according to the rules, one should touch (the sacred objects).

analyzed: puruṣasūktena pratyṛcam puruṣāya puṣpāni dadyāt
translated: With the Purusha Sukta, one should offer flowers to the Purusha (Vishnu) for each verse.

analyzed: udaka añjalīn ca
translated: And water-filled cupped hands.

original: ādāv eva daivena tīrthena devānāṃ tarpaṇaṃ kuryāt //🔽tadanantaraṃ pitryeṇa pitṝṇām //
analyzed: ādau eva daivena tīrthena devānām tarpaṇam kuryāt  tad anantaram pitryeṇa pitṝṇām
translated: First, with the divine mode of worship, one should offer libations to the gods.🔽After that, with the ancestral mode of worship, to the ancestors.

analyzed: tatra ādau sva vaṃśyānām tarpaṇam kuryāt  tatas saṃbandhi bāndhavānām
translated: There, first, one should offer libations to one's own ancestors.🔽Then to one's relatives and kinsmen.

analyzed: tatas suhṛdām
translated: Then to one's friends.

analyzed: evam nitya snāyī syāt
translated: Thus one should always bathe.

analyzed: snātaḥ ca pavitrāṇi yathāśakti japet
translated: And having bathed, one should recite the sacred hymns as much as one can.

analyzed: viśeṣataḥ sāvitrīm
translated: Especially the Savitri (hymn).

analyzed: puruṣasūktam ca
translated: And the Purusha Sukta (hymn).

analyzed: na etābhyām adhikam asti
translated: There is nothing superior to these two.

original: pavitrāṇāṃ tathā japye dāne ca vidhibodhite //
analyzed: pavitrāṇām tathā japye dāne ca vidhi bodhite
translated: Thus, in the recitation and offering of sacred hymns as enjoined by the rules,

analyzed: alaksmīḥ kālakarṇī ca duḥsvapnam durvicintitam
translated: Ill-luck, Kali, bad dreams, and evil thoughts,

original: athātaḥ susnātaḥ suprakṣālitapāṇipādaḥ svācānto devatārcāyāṃ sthale vā bhagavantam anādinidhanaṃ vāsudevam abhyarcayet //
analyzed: atha atas su snātaḥ su prakṣālita pāṇi pādaḥ su ācāntaḥ devatā arcāyām sthale vā bhagavantam an ādi nidhanam vāsudevam abhyarcayet
translated: Now, having bathed well and having washed the hands and feet well, having sipped water, one should worship the Lord, who has no beginning and no end, Vasudeva, in a temple or on a clean ground.

original: aśvinoḥ prāṇas tau ta iti jīvādānaṃ dattvā yuñjate mana ity anuvākenāvāhanaṃ kṛtvā jānubhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ śirasā ca namaskāraṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: aśvinoḥ prāṇaḥ tau te iti jīvādānam dattvā yuñjate manaḥ iti anuvākena āvāhanam kṛtvā jānubhyām pāṇibhyām śirasā ca namaskāram kuryāt
translated: Having given the life of the Ashvins to them, having performed the invocation with the Anuvaka beginning with yunjate manaḥ, he should offer salutations with his knees, hands and head.

original: āpo hi ṣṭheti tisṛbhir arghyaṃ nivedayet //
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha iti tisṛbhiḥ arghyam nivedayet
translated: With the three verses beginning with Āpo hi ṣṭhā, he should offer Arghya.

analyzed: hiraṇya varṇāḥ iti catasṛbhiḥ pādyam
translated: With the four verses beginning with Hiraṇyavarṇā, he should offer Pādya.

original: śaṃ na āpo dhanvanyā ity ācamanīyam //
analyzed: śam naḥ āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ iti ācamanīyam
translated: With the verse Śam no 'pāṃ dhanvanīyasām, he should offer Ācamaniya.

analyzed: idam āpaḥ pravahata iti snānīyam
translated: With the verse Idam āpaḥ pravahata, he should offer Snāniya.

original: rathe akṣeṣu vrṣabhasya vāje ity anulepanālaṃkārau //
analyzed: rathe akṣeṣu vṛṣabhasya vāje iti anulepana alaṃkārau
translated: With the verse Rathe akṣeṣu vṛṣabhasya vāje, he should offer Anulepana and Alaṅkāra.

analyzed: yuvā su vāsāḥ iti vāsaḥ
translated: With the verse Yuvā suvāsāḥ, he should offer Vāsa.

analyzed: puṣpāvatīḥ iti puṣpam
translated: With the verse Puṣpavātīḥ, he should offer flowers.

analyzed: dhūḥ asi dhūrvā iti dhūpam
translated: With the verse Dhūr asi dhūrva, he should offer Dhūpa.

analyzed: tejaḥ si śukram iti dīpam
translated: With the verse Tejo 'si śukram, he should offer Dīpa.

analyzed: dadhikrāvṇaḥ iti madhuparkam
translated: With the verse Dadhikrāvṇa, he should offer Madhuparka.

analyzed: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ iti aṣṭābhiḥ naivedyam
translated: With the eight verses beginning with Hiraṇyagarbhaḥ, he should offer Naivedya.

original: cāmaraṃ vyajanaṃ mātrāṃ chatraṃ yānāsane tathā / sāvitreṇaiva tat sarvaṃ devāya vinivedayet //
analyzed: cāmaram vyajanam mātrām chatram yāna āsane tathā sāvitreṇa eva tat sarvam devāya vinivedayet
translated: He should offer to the Lord with the Sāvitrī mantra itself the chowrie, fan, mirror, umbrella, vehicle and seat.

original: evam abhyarcya tu japet sūktaṃ vai pauruṣaṃ tataḥ / tenaiva cājyaṃ juhuyād yadīcchec chāśvataṃ padam //
analyzed: evam abhyarcya tu japet sūktam vai pauruṣam tatas  tena eva ca ājyam juhuyāt yadi icchet śāśvatam padam
translated: Having thus worshipped, one should then recite the Purusha Sukta. With the same, one should offer ghee oblations, if one desires the eternal state.

analyzed: na naktam gṛhītena udakena deva pitṛ karma kuryāt
translated: One should not perform rites for gods and ancestors with water taken at night.

analyzed: cadana mṛgamada dāru karpūra kuṅkuma jātīphala varjam anulepanam na dadyāt
translated: One should not offer unguents except sandalwood, musk, deodar, camphor, saffron, and nutmeg.

analyzed: na vāsaḥ nīlī raktam
translated: One should not wear clothes dyed with indigo.

analyzed: na maṇi suvarṇayoḥ pratirūpam alaṃkaraṇam
translated: One should not wear ornaments that are imitations of gems and gold.

analyzed: na agandhi
translated: They should not be foul-smelling.

original: na kaṇṭakijam //🔽kaṇṭakijam api śuklaṃ sugandhikaṃ tu dadyāt //
analyzed: na kaṇṭaki jam  kaṇṭaki jam api śuklam sugandhikam tu dadyāt
translated: They should not be from thorny plants.🔽One may offer white and fragrant flowers from thorny plants.

original: raktam api kuṅkumaṃ jalajaṃ ca dadyāt //
analyzed: raktam api kuṅkumam jalajam ca dadyāt
translated: One may offer red saffron and water-born flowers.

analyzed: na dhūpa arthe jīva jātam
translated: One should not use living beings for incense.

original: na ghṛtatailaṃ vinā kiṃcana dīpārthe //🔽nābhakṣyaṃ naivedyārthe //
analyzed: na ghṛta tailam vinā kiṃcana dīpa arthe  na abhakṣyam naivedya arthe
translated: One should not use anything except ghee and oil for lamps.🔽One should not offer non-edible items as food offerings.

analyzed: na bhakṣye api ajā mahiṣī kṣīre
translated: One should not offer the milk of goats and buffaloes even as food.

analyzed: pañcanakha matsya varāha māṃsāni ca
translated: And the meat of five-nailed animals, fish, and boar.

original: prayataś ca śucir bhūtvā sarvam eva nivedayet / tanmanāḥ sumanā bhūtvā tvarākrodhavivarjitaḥ //
analyzed: prayataḥ ca śuciḥ bhūtvā sarvam eva nivedayet tad manāḥ su manāḥ bhūtvā tvarā krodha vivarjitaḥ
translated: And one should offer everything with effort and purity, with a focused mind, a cheerful mind, and free from haste and anger.

original: athāgniṃ parisamuhya paryukṣya paristīrya pariṣicya sarvataḥ pākād agram uddhṛtya juhuyāt //
analyzed: atha agnim parisamuhya paryukṣya paristīrya pariṣicya sarvatas pākāt agram uddhṛtya juhuyāt
translated: Then, having swept around the fire, having sprinkled it, having strewn it around, having sprinkled (water) all around, having taken the first portion from all the cooked food, he should offer it.

original: vāsudevāya saṃkarṣaṇāya pradyumnāyāniruddhāya puruṣāya satyāyācyutāya vāsudevāya //
analyzed: vāsudevāya saṃkarṣaṇāya pradyumnāya aniruddhāya puruṣāya satyāya acyutāya vāsudevāya
translated: To Vāsudeva, to Saṃkarṣaṇa, to Pradyumna, to Aniruddha, to Puruṣottama, to Satya, to Acyuta, to Vāsudeva.

analyzed: varuṇāya indrāya indra agnibhyām
translated: To Varuṇa. To Indra. To Indra and Agni.

analyzed: tatas nna śeṣeṇa balim upaharet bhakṣa upabhakṣābhyām
translated: Then he should offer the Bali with the remaining food. With food and drink.

analyzed: abhitas pūrveṇa agnim
translated: All around, to the east of the fire.

analyzed: ambā nāma asi iti
translated: Her name is Ambā.

analyzed: dulā nāma asi iti
translated: Her name is Dulā.

analyzed: nitantī nāma asi iti
translated: Her name is Nitan.

analyzed: cupuṇīkā nāma asi iti sarvāsām
translated: Her name is Cupoṇikā. All of them.

original: nandini subhage sumaṅgali bhadraṃkarīti svaśriṣv abhipradakṣiṇam //
analyzed: nandini subhage su maṅgali bhadraṃkari iti su aśriṣu abhipradakṣiṇam
translated: O Nandini, O auspicious one, O well-omened one, O bringer of good fortune, in his own house, moving clockwise.

original: sthūṇāyāṃ dhruvāyāṃ śriyai hiraṇyakeśyai vanaspatibhyaś ca //
analyzed: sthūṇāyām dhruvāyām śriyai hiraṇya keśyai vanaspatibhyaḥ ca
translated: On the firm post, to Śrī with golden hair, and to the trees.

analyzed: dharma adharmayoḥ dvāre mṛtyave ca
translated: At the door of Dharma and Adharma, to Death.

analyzed: uda dhāne varuṇāya
translated: In the reservoir, to Varuṇa.

analyzed: viṣṇave iti ulūkhale
translated: To Viṣṇu, in the mortar.

analyzed: marudbhyaḥ iti dṛṣadi
translated: To the Maruts, on the stone.

original: upari śaraṇe vaiśravaṇāya rājñe bhūtebhyaś ca //
analyzed: upari śaraṇe vaiśravaṇāya rājñe bhūtebhyaḥ ca
translated: Above in the shelter, to King Vaiśravaṇa and to the beings.

analyzed: indrāya indra puruṣebhyaḥ ca iti pūrva ardhe
translated: To Indra and Indra's men, in the eastern part.

analyzed: yamāya yama puruṣebhyaḥ iti
translated: To Yama and the servants of Yama, in the southern half.

analyzed: varuṇāya varuṇa puruṣebhyaḥ iti paśca ardhe
translated: To Varuṇa and the servants of Varuṇa, in the western half.

analyzed: somāya soma puruṣebhyaḥ iti uttara ardhe
translated: To Soma and the servants of Soma, in the northern half.

analyzed: brahmaṇe brahma puruṣebhyaḥ iti madhye
translated: To Brahman and the servants of Brahman, in the middle.

analyzed: ūrdhvam ākāśāya
translated: Upwards, to space.

analyzed: sthaṇḍile divācarebhyaḥ bhūtebhyaḥ iti divā
translated: On the sacrificial ground, to the beings that move during the day, during the day.

analyzed: naktaṃcarebhyaḥ iti naktam
translated: To those that move during the night, during the night.

original: tato dakṣiṇāgreṣu darbheṣu pitre pitāmahāya prapitāmahāya mātre pitāmahyai prapitāmahyai nāmagotrābhyāṃ ca piṇḍanirvāpaṇaṃ kuryāt dakṣiṇagreṣu
analyzed: tatas dakṣiṇa agreṣu darbheṣu pitre pitāmahāya prapitāmahāya mātre pitāmahyai prapitāmahyai nāma gotrābhyām ca piṇḍa nirvāpaṇam kuryāt dakṣiṇa agreṣu
translated: Then, on kuśa grass with the tips pointing to the south, he should offer piṇḍas to his father, grandfather, great-grandfather, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother, by name and gotra.

analyzed: piṇḍānām ca anulepana puṣpa dhūpa naivedya ādi dadyāt
translated: And he should offer anointment, flowers, incense, offerings, etc. to the piṇḍas.

analyzed: udaka kalaśam upanidhāya svastyayanam vācayet
translated: Having placed a water pot, he should recite the Svasti-offering.

analyzed: śva kāka śvapacānām bhuvi nirvapet
translated: He should offer on the ground to dogs, crows, and outcasts.

original: bhikṣāṃ ca dadyāt //🔽atithipūjane ca paraṃ yatnam ātiṣṭheta //
analyzed: bhikṣām ca dadyāt  atithi pūjane ca param yatnam ātiṣṭheta
translated: And he should give alms.🔽And he should make the greatest effort in honoring guests.

analyzed: sāyam atithim prāptam prayatnena arcayet
translated: In the evening, he should worship with effort a guest who has arrived.

analyzed: an āśitam atithim gṛhe na vāsayet
translated: He should not keep an unfed guest in his house.

original: yathā varṇānāṃ brāhmaṇaḥ prabhur yathā strīṇāṃ bhartā tathā gṛhasthasyātithiḥ //
analyzed: yathā varṇānām brāhmaṇaḥ prabhuḥ yathā strīṇām bhartā tathā gṛhasthasya atithiḥ
translated: As the Brahmana is the lord of the castes, as the husband is the lord of the wife, so is the guest the lord of the householder.

analyzed: tad pūjayā svargam āpnoti
translated: By honouring him, one attains heaven.

analyzed: atithiḥ yasya bhagna āśaḥ gṛhāt pratinivartate
translated: If a guest returns from a house with his hopes disappointed, he takes away all the merit the householder has acquired during a whole year.

original: ekarātraṃ hi nivasann atithir brāhmaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: eka rātram hi nivasan atithiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: A Brahmana who stays for one night is considered a guest.

original: anityaṃ hi sthito yasmāt tasmād atithir ucyate //
analyzed: anityam hi sthitaḥ yasmāt tasmāt atithiḥ ucyate
translated: Because he stays for an impermanent time, he is called a guest.

original: naikagrāmīṇam atithiṃ vipraṃ sāṃgatikaṃ tathā / upasthitaṃ gṛhe vindyād bhāryā yatrāgnayo 'pi vā //
analyzed: na eka grāmīṇam atithim vipram sāṃgatikam tathā upasthitam gṛhe vindyāt bhāryā vā
translated: One should not consider a Brahmana who lives in the same village or a companion as a guest, or one who is present in the house where his wife and fires are.

original: yadi tv atithidharmeṇa kṣatriyo gṛham āgataḥ / bhuktavatsu ca vipresu kāmaṃ tam api bhojayet //
analyzed: yadi tu atithi dharmeṇa kṣatriyaḥ gṛham āgataḥ bhuktavatsu ca vipresu kāmam tam api bhojayet
translated: But if a Kshatriya comes to the house as a guest, even after the Brahmanas have eaten, one may feed him if one wishes.

original: vaiśyaśūdrāv api prāptau kuṭumbe 'tithidharmiṇau / bhojayet saha bhṛtyais tāv ānṛśaṃsyaṃ prayojayan //
analyzed: vaiśya śūdrau api prāptau kuṭumbe tithi dharmiṇau bhojayet saha bhṛtyaiḥ tau ānṛśaṃsyam prayojayan
translated: Even a Vaishya or a Shudra who has arrived as a guest in the house, one should feed along with his servants, motivated by compassion.

original: itarān api sakhyādīn saṃprītyā gṛham āgatān / prakṛtānnaṃ yathāśakti bhojayet saha bhāryayā //
analyzed: itarān api sakhi ādīn saṃprītyā gṛham āgatān prakṛta annam yathāśakti bhojayet saha bhāryayā
translated: And others too, such as friends, who come to the house out of affection, one should feed with the food that is available, to the best of one's ability, along with one's wife.

original: svavāsinīṃ kumārīṃ ca rogiṇīṃ gurviṇīṃ tathā / atithibhyo 'gra evaitān bhojayed avicārayan //
analyzed: svavāsinīm kumārīm ca rogiṇīm gurviṇīm tathā atithibhyaḥ gre eva etān bhojayet a vicārayan
translated: He should feed without hesitation, even before the guests, a maiden, a sick person, a pregnant woman, and one who resides in his house.

original: adattvā yas tu etebhyaḥ pūrvaṃ bhuṅkte 'vicakṣaṇaḥ / bhuñjāno na sa jānāti śvagṛdhrair jagdhim ātmanaḥ //
analyzed: a dattvā yaḥ tu etebhyaḥ pūrvam bhuṅkte vicakṣaṇaḥ bhuñjānaḥ na sa jānāti śva gṛdhraiḥ jagdhim ātmanaḥ
translated: The unwise man who eats before giving food to these, does not know that he is being devoured by dogs and vultures.

original: bhuktavatsu ca vipreṣu sveṣu bhṛtyeṣu caiva hi /
analyzed: bhuktavatsu ca vipreṣu sveṣu bhṛtyeṣu ca eva hi
translated: When the Brahmanas have eaten, and also his own servants,

original: devān pitṝn manuṣyāṃś ca bhṛtyān gṛhyāś ca devatāḥ / pūjayitvā tataḥ paścād gṛhasthaḥ śeṣabhug bhavet //
analyzed: devān pitṝn manuṣyān ca bhṛtyān gṛhyāḥ ca devatāḥ pūjayitvā tatas paścāt gṛhasthaḥ śeṣa bhuj bhavet
translated: The householder should eat what is left after worshipping the gods, the manes, men, servants, and the deities of the house.

original: aghaṃ sa kevalaṃ bhuṅkte yaḥ pacaty ātmakāraṇāt / yajñaśiṣṭāśanaṃ hy etat satām annaṃ vidhīyate //
analyzed: agham sa kevalam bhuṅkte yaḥ pacati ātma kāraṇāt yajña śiṣṭa aśanam hi etat satām annam vidhīyate
translated: He who cooks for himself alone, eats only sin; for the food of the good is that which remains after the performance of sacrifices.

original: svādhyāyenāgnihotreṇa yajñena tapasā tathā / na cāpnoti gṛhī lokān yathā tv atithipūjanāt //
analyzed: svādhyāyena agnihotreṇa yajñena tapasā tathā na ca āpnoti gṛhī lokān yathā tu atithi pūjanāt
translated: The householder does not attain those worlds by Vedic study, by Agnihotra, by sacrifice, or by austerity, as he does by honouring guests.

original: sāyaṃ prātas tv atithaye pradadyād āsanodake / annaṃ caiva yathāśaktyā satkṛtya vidhipūrvakam //
analyzed: sāyam prātar tu atithaye pradadyāt āsana udake annam ca eva yathāśaktyā satkṛtya vidhi pūrvakam
translated: In the evening and in the morning, he should give to the guest a seat and water, and also food according to his ability, honouring him with due rites.

original: pratiśrayaṃ tathā śayyāṃ pādābhyaṅgaṃ sadīpakam / pratyekadānenāpnoti gopradānasamaṃ phalam //
analyzed: pratiśrayam tathā śayyām pāda abhyaṅgam sa dīpakam pratyeka dānena āpnoti go pradāna samam phalam
translated: By giving shelter, a bed, foot-massage, and a lamp, one obtains the same fruit as by giving a cow, each gift being equal to the gift of a cow.

analyzed: candra arka uparāge na aśnīyāt  snātvā muktayoḥ aśnīyāt
translated: One should not eat during a lunar or solar eclipse.🔽One should eat after bathing when the eclipses are over.

original: amuktayor astaṃ gatayoḥ snātvā dṛṣṭvā cāpare 'hni //
analyzed: amuktayoḥ astam gatayoḥ snātvā dṛṣṭvā ca apare hni
translated: If the eclipses are not over, one should bathe and eat the next day after seeing [the moon or sun].

analyzed: na go brāhmaṇa uparāge śnīyāt
translated: One should not eat during a lunar or solar eclipse.

analyzed: na rājñaḥ vyasane
translated: One should not eat during a king's calamity.

analyzed: pravasita agnihotrī yadā agnihotram kṛtam manyate tadā aśnīyāt
translated: One who is away from the Agnihotra should eat when one thinks the Agnihotra has been performed.

analyzed: yadā kṛtam manyeta vaiśvadevam api
translated: When one thinks the Vaiśvadeva has been performed, it is the same.

original: parvaṇi ca yadā kṛtaṃ manyeta parva //🔽nāśnīyāc cājīrṇe //🔽nārdharātre //
analyzed: parvaṇi ca yadā kṛtam manyeta parva  na aśnīyāt ca ajīrṇe  na ardharātre
translated: When one thinks the Parva has been performed, it is the same.🔽One should not eat when one has indigestion.🔽One should not eat at midnight.

analyzed: na madyāhne  na saṃdhyayoḥ  na ārdra vāsāḥ
translated: One should not eat in the afternoon.🔽One should not eat at dusk or dawn.

analyzed: na eka vāsāḥ  na nagnaḥ  na udake
translated: One should not eat while wet.🔽One should not eat while wearing only one garment.🔽One should not eat naked.

analyzed: na utkuṭakaḥ  na bhinna āsana gataḥ
translated: One should not eat in water.🔽One should not eat while standing.

original: na ca śayanagataḥ //🔽na bhinnabhojane // notsaṅge //🔽na bhuvi //
analyzed: na ca śayana gataḥ  na bhinna bhojane na utsaṅge  na bhuvi
translated: One should not eat while sitting on a broken seat.🔽One should not eat while lying down.

analyzed: na pāṇau
translated: One should not eat in a broken vessel, on one's lap,🔽on the ground,🔽or in one's hand.

original: lavaṇaṃ ca yatra dadyāt tan nāśnīyāt //
analyzed: lavaṇam ca yatra dadyāt tat na aśnīyāt
translated: One should not eat where salt is given.

analyzed: na bālakān nirbhatseyan  na ekaḥ mṛṣṭam
translated: One should not frighten children.🔽One should not eat alone what is delicious.

analyzed: na uddhṛta sneham
translated: One should not eat what has had the oil removed.

analyzed: na divā dhānāḥ
translated: Not parched grains during the day.

analyzed: na rātrau tila saṃbandham
translated: Not anything connected with sesamum at night.

analyzed: na dadhi saktūn
translated: Not curd and flour-cakes.

analyzed: na kovidāra vaṭa pippala śāṇa śākam
translated: Not the vegetables of kovidāra, banyan, pippala, and śaṇa.

analyzed: na a dattvā  na a hutvā  na an ārdra kara mukhaḥ ca
translated: Not without having given.🔽Not without having offered in the fire.🔽And not with dry hands and mouth.

analyzed: na ucchiṣṭaḥ ca ghṛtam ādadyāt
translated: And one should not take ghee while having remnants of food in the mouth.

analyzed: na candra arka tārakāḥ nirīkṣeta
translated: One should not look at the sun, moon, or stars.

analyzed: na mūrdhānam spṛśet
translated: One should not touch one's head.

analyzed: na brahma kīrtayet  prāc mukhaḥ śnīyāt
translated: One should not recite the Veda.🔽One should eat facing the east.

analyzed: dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ vā
translated: Or facing the south.

analyzed: abhipūjya annam
translated: One should honor the food.

analyzed: sumanāḥ sragvī anuliptaḥ ca
translated: With a good mind, wearing garlands, and anointed.

analyzed: na niḥśeṣa kṛt syāt
translated: One should not eat everything.

analyzed: anyatra dadhi madhu sarpiḥ payaḥ saktu pala modakebhyaḥ
translated: Except curd, honey, ghee, milk, flour, sugar-cane, and sweet cakes.

original: nāśnīyād bhāryayā sārdhaṃ nākāśe na tathotthitaḥ / bahūnāṃ prekṣamāṇānāṃ naikasmin bahavas tathā //
analyzed: na aśnīyāt bhāryayā sārdham na ākāśe na tathā utthitaḥ bahūnām prekṣamāṇānām na ekasmin bahavaḥ tathā
translated: One should not eat with one's wife, nor in the sky, nor standing, nor in the presence of many, nor many in the presence of one.

original: śūnyālaye vahnigṛhe devāgāre kathaṃcana / piben nāñjalinā toyaṃ nātisauhityam ācaret //
analyzed: śūnya ālaye vahni gṛhe devāgāre kathaṃcana pibet na añjalinā toyam na ati sauhityam ācaret
translated: One should never drink water with cupped hands in an empty house, a temple of fire, or a temple of gods. One should not eat too much.

original: na tṛtīyam athāśnīta na cāpathyaṃ kathaṃcana / nātiprage nātisāyaṃ na sāyaṃ prātar āśitaḥ //
analyzed: na tṛtīyam atha aśnīta na ca apathyam kathaṃcana na atiprage na atisāyam na sāyam prātar āśitaḥ
translated: One should not eat a third meal, nor anything unwholesome. Not too early in the morning, not too late in the evening, not in the evening after eating in the morning.

original: na bhāvaduṣṭam aśnīyān na bhāṇḍe bhāvadūṣite / śayānaḥ prauḍhapādaś ca kṛtvā caivāvasakthikām //
analyzed: na bhāva duṣṭam aśnīyāt na bhāṇḍe bhāva dūṣite  śayānaḥ prauḍha pādaḥ ca kṛtvā ca eva avasakthikām
translated: He should not eat food that is spoiled, nor from a vessel that is spoiled. He should not sleep with his feet stretched out or with his legs crossed.

analyzed: na aṣṭamī caturdaśī pañcadaśīṣu striyam upeyāt
translated: He should not approach a woman on the eighth, fourteenth, or fifteenth days.

analyzed: na śrāddham bhuktvā  na dattvā
translated: Not after partaking of a śrāddha meal.🔽Not after giving a śrāddha meal.

analyzed: na upanimantritaḥ śrāddhe
translated: Not when invited to a śrāddha.

analyzed: na devāyatana śmaśāna śūnya ālayeṣu
translated: Not in a temple, cremation ground, or empty house.

analyzed: na vṛkṣa mūleṣu  na divā
translated: Not at the foot of a tree.🔽Not during the day.

analyzed: na saṃdhyayoḥ  na malinaḥ
translated: Not during twilight.🔽Not while dirty.

analyzed: na roga ārtām
translated: Not a woman who is sick.

analyzed: na roga ārtaḥ
translated: Not a man who is sick.

original: na hīnāṅgīṃ nādhikāṅgīṃ tathaiva ca vayo 'dhikām / nopeyād gurviṇīṃ nārīṃ dīrgham āyur jijīviṣuḥ //
analyzed: na hīna aṅgīm na adhika aṅgīm tathā eva ca vayaḥ dhikām  na upeyāt gurviṇīm nārīm dīrgham āyuḥ jijīviṣuḥ
translated: One who wishes to live a long life should not approach a woman who is deficient in limbs, who has extra limbs, who is too old, or who is pregnant.

analyzed: na ārdra pādaḥ supyāt  na uttara apara śirāḥ
translated: One should not sleep with wet feet.🔽Not with one's head to the north or west.

analyzed: na nagnaḥ  na anuvaṃśam  na ākāśe
translated: Not naked.🔽Not in one's own ancestral bed.🔽Not in the open air.

analyzed: na pālāśe śayane
translated: Not on a bed of Palāśa wood.

analyzed: na pañca dāru kṛte  na gaja bhagna kṛte
translated: Not on a bed made of five kinds of wood.🔽Not on a bed broken by an elephant.

analyzed: na vidyut dagdha kṛte
translated: Not on a bed burnt by lightning.

analyzed: na bhinne  na agni pṛṣṭhe  na ghaṭa āsikta druma je
translated: Not on a broken bed.🔽Not on a bed with a burnt back.🔽Not on a bed made of a tree struck by a pot.

analyzed: na śmaśāna śūnya ālaya devatāyataneṣu
translated: Not in a cremation ground, empty house, or temple.

analyzed: na capala madhye
translated: Not in the midst of the fickle.

analyzed: na nārī madhye
translated: Not in the midst of women.

analyzed: na dhānya go guru hutāśana surāṇām upari
translated: Nor over grains, cows, the preceptor, fire, or the gods.

original: nocchiṣṭo na divā supyāt saṃdhyayor na ca bhasmani / deśe na ca aśucau nārdre na ca parvatamastake //
analyzed: na ucchiṣṭaḥ na divā supyāt saṃdhyayoḥ na ca bhasmani deśe na ca aśucau na ārdre na ca parvata mastake
translated: He should not sleep with remnants of food in his mouth, during the day, at twilight, on ashes, in an impure place, in a wet place, or on the top of a mountain.

analyzed: atha na kaṃcana avamanyeta
translated: Then he should not despise anyone.

original: na ca hīnādhikāṅgān mūrkhān dhanahīnān avahaset //
analyzed: na ca hīna adhika aṅgān mūrkhān dhana hīnān avahaset
translated: And he should not ridicule those who are deficient or excessive in limbs, who are foolish, or who are poor.

analyzed: na hīnān seveta
translated: He should not serve those who are inferior.

analyzed: svādhyāya virodhi karma na ācaret
translated: He should not perform acts that are contrary to self-study.

analyzed: vayaḥ nurūpam veṣam kuryāt
translated: He should dress in a manner suitable to his age.

analyzed: śrutasya abhijanasya dhanasya deśasya ca
translated: Of learning, family, wealth, and country.

analyzed: na uddhataḥ
translated: He should not be arrogant.

analyzed: nityam śāstra ādi avekṣī syāt
translated: He should always look to the scriptures and so on.

original: na nāstīty abhibhāṣeta // na nirgandhogragandhi raktaṃ ca mālyaṃ bibhṛyāt //
analyzed: na na asti iti abhibhāṣeta na nirgandha ugra gandhi raktam ca mālyam bibhṛyāt
translated: He should not speak of non-existence. He should not wear garlands that are scentless, of strong scent, or red.

original: bibhṛyāj jalajaṃ raktam api //🔽yaṣṭiṃ ca vaiṇavīm //
analyzed: bibhṛyāt jala jam raktam api  yaṣṭim ca vaiṇavīm
